0.title: Satellite pic shows nuclear bombers deployed by Russia near NATO border
0.article_body: Satellite images from an independent Norwegian fact-checking website have shown that Russia has deployed 11 nuclear-capable long-range bombers at an airbase close to neighbouring Norway, which is a NATO member. Seven Tu-160s and four Tu-95 planes have reportedly been parked at the Olenya Air Base, as per pictures released by Faktisk.no. The number of Tu-160s parked there has steadily increased.

1.title: There's a real calmness, confidence in our team: Aaron Finch
1.article_body: Australian skipper Aaron Finch said that there is calmness among the team members ahead of the T20 World Cup. "It would have been nice to win against England but it's not the be-all and end-all...There's a real...confidence that we know our best is good enough on the day," Finch said. Notably, Australia lost the T20I series to England by 2-0.

2.title: Eradicating corruption is Haryana govt's utmost priority: CM Khattar
2.article_body: Haryana CM Manohar Lal Khattar on Saturday said eradicating corruption is his government's utmost priority. "Concrete steps have been taken in this direction," Khattar said. Speaking at a function in Haryana's Nayagaon, Khattar said he has made power a means to serve people and dedicated efforts are being made to raise the living standard of the poor through government schemes.

3.title: UP policemen who killed my wife were drunk: BJP leader Gurtaj Singh
3.article_body: BJP leader Gurtaj Singh has alleged that Uttar Pradesh Police officials who barged into his home and shot his wife dead in Uttarakhand on Friday were drunk. Gurpreet Kaur was killed while officials were chasing a criminal. Singh said, "[Police] are spreading propaganda that they were kept hostage." He added, "I'm...a public representative of the government, yet...this happened to me."

4.title: PCB appoints dedicated physio for Shaheen, Fakhar for T20 WC: Reports
4.article_body: The Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) has reportedly appointed a dedicated physiotherapist for bowler Shaheen Shah Afridi and batter Fakhar Zaman during the T20 World Cup in Australia. Due to the kind of injuries suffered by the duo, PCB reportedly asked London-based physiotherapist, Dr Javed Akhtar Mughal, to join the squad. Dr Mughal worked with the players during their recent rehabilitation.

5.title: ED attaches properties worth ₹1,317 crore of Ireo Group
5.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) has attached properties worth around ₹1,317 crore linked to the Ireo Group. The senior management of the group is alleged to have siphoned off ₹1,225 crore of funds belonging to homebuyers. The attached properties include residential premises, commercial spaces, bank accounts belonging to the company and its chairman Lalit Goyal.

6.title: 'Mirzapur' fame actor Jitendra Shastri passes away
6.article_body: Actor Jitendra Shastri, who was known for playing the role of Usmaan in the Ali Fazal and Pankaj Tripathi-led web series 'Mirzapur', has passed away. Actor Sanjay Mishra took to social media to share the news. Actor Rajesh Tailang, while mourning his demise, tweeted "Can't believe Jitu Bhai is no more, what an amazing actor, what a wonderful human being."

7.title: They've shown outstanding skill, teamwork: PM on India's Women's Asia Cup win
7.article_body: PM Narendra Modi congratulated India following their record-extending seventh Women's Asia Cup title on Saturday. "Our women's cricket team makes us proud with their grit and dexterity!...They have shown outstanding skill and teamwork," tweeted PM Modi. BCCI Secretary Jay Shah took to Twitter and wrote, "Congratulations to Harmanpreet Kaur and her team for raising the bar in women's cricket."

8.title: 21-yr-old Man Utd footballer Greenwood charged with attempted rape, controlling behaviour
8.article_body: Manchester United's 21-year-old footballer Mason Greenwood has been charged with attempted rape, engaging in controlling behaviour and assault. He was initially arrested in January after social media images and videos were posted by a woman reporting incidents of physical violence. He has been suspended by United pending investigation. The alleged rape is said to have occurred on October 22, 2021.

9.title: Was obsessed with Sridevi, I used to imitate her: Shefali Shah
9.article_body: Actress Shefali Shah said in an interview that earlier she was obsessed with late actress Sridevi. "I was also told that I looked like her and then slowly I started imitating her," she added. "Thankfully, wisdom came knocking one day and I was like what am I doing? There can't be another Sridevi, so stop it," Shefali further said.

10.title: Bhuvneshwar is still the go-to guy for Rohit Sharma: Suresh Raina
10.article_body: Ex-Indian cricketer Suresh Raina said that seamer Bhuvneshwar Kumar is still the go-to guy for skipper Rohit Sharma. "Bhuvneshwar is an experienced bowler...Sometimes you go for runs, but he still has that swing," Raina said. He added, "When Virat [Kohli] scored a hundred, [Bhuvneshwar] also took five wickets against Afghanistan...He has that knuckleball, swing and he hits areas well."

11.title: 18-yr-old NEET aspirant dies of liver disease in Raj, 35 other students ill
11.article_body: An 18-year-old NEET aspirant, who was diagnosed with severe liver disease, died during treatment at a private hospital in Rajasthan's Kota, an official said on Saturday. The victim was among 36 students, who were suffering from the disease. Kota CMHO said three water suppliers in the area were found to be supplying contaminated drinking water to coaching institutes and canteens.

12.title: Just stuck to basics and got rewards: Renuka on 3/5 in Asia Cup final
12.article_body: India pacer Renuka Singh said she's happy to be named 'Player of the Match' in India's eight-wicket win against Sri Lanka in Women's Asia Cup 2022 final. Renuka posted bowling figures of 3-1-5-3. "In...last few games, I didn't bowl well. I practised with my coach...staff and got better. I didn't try anything, just stuck to...basics and got rewards," she added.

13.title: Waited for 12-14 hrs for Kareena during my debut film's shoot: Tusshar
13.article_body: Tusshar Kapoor, speaking on the insider versus outsider debate, said that a "red carpet" is not laid out for every star kid. "While shooting for my debut film, 'Mujhe Kucch Kehna Hai', I'd to wait for...co-star and another star kid Kareena Kapoor...for 12-14 hours as she was simultaneously working on four films," he said, adding he considers himself an outsider.

14.title: Immediately starting work on gas hub proposed by Russia: Turkey
14.article_body: Turkish and Russian officials have been told to immediately start technical work on a proposed natural gas hub in Turkey, President Recep Erdogan has said. Russian President Vladimir Putin had earlier proposed that this hub could sell gas "to third countries, especially in Europe". The proposal aims to export more gas through the TurkStream gas pipeline.

15.title: Video shows UP policeman stealing bulb from shop; suspended
15.article_body: Sub-inspector Rajesh Verma from Uttar Pradesh Police was suspended after a video of him stealing a bulb from outside a shop went viral. The video shows Verma discreetly looking around before removing the bulb. He then puts it in his pocket and walks away. Defending himself, Verma said he removed the bulb as it was dark where he was stationed.

16.title: 5 drug peddlers booked under PSA in J&K's Budgam district
16.article_body: Five alleged drug peddlers were booked under the Public Safety Act (PSA) in J&K's Budgam district, police said on Saturday. The PSA was invoked against the accused after obtaining sanctions from the competent authority, as per the police. The accused were involved in 12 cases registered under the Narcotic Drugs and Psychotropic Substances (NDPS) Act across central Kashmir, police added.

17.title: Kashmir Freedom Fighters claims responsibility for killing Kashmiri Pandit in J&K
17.article_body: Hours after Puran Krishan Bhat, a Kashmiri Pandit, died after being shot in Jammu and Kashmir's Shopian district on Saturday, terror outfit Kashmir Freedom Fighters has claimed responsibility for the killing, police said. Bhat was on his way to an orchard in Chowdari Gund when he was fired upon. Police said they are ascertaining the reason behind the killing.

18.title: Mistakes were made: New UK Finance Minister on recent tax cuts
18.article_body: UK's new Finance Minister Jeremy Hunt on Saturday said his predecessor had made some "mistakes", referring to the tax cuts announced last month. "We will have some very difficult decisions ahead," Hunt said. His predecessor Kwasi Kwarteng was sacked by Prime Minister Liz Truss on Friday, after less than six weeks on the job.

19.title: Illegal property of 2 drug peddlers demolished in Haryana's Fatehabad
19.article_body: The district authorities on Saturday demolished an illegally built house of two drug peddler brothers in Haryana's Fatehabad. "Both the brothers were booked in 14 cases under...NDPS Act," Jakhal Police Station SHO Jai Bhagwan said. "One week ago, the municipal committee officials had served notice to the family of these peddlers asking them to vacate the house," SHO added.

20.title: Which are the best & worst-performing countries as per latest global hunger rankings?
20.article_body: Seventeen countries have shared the top rank in the Global Hunger Index 2022, including China, Belarus, Turkey, Chile, Croatia, Estonia, Hungary and Kuwait. These countries got a score of less than five on the index. Among the worst-performing nations is Yemen (ranked last at 121st position) followed by the Central African Republic, Madagascar, the Democratic Republic of Congo, Chad etc.

21.title: 2 killed in road accident in Jharkhand's Dumka district
21.article_body: Two people were killed following a collision between a motorcycle and a truck carrying stone chips in Jharkhand's Dumka district on Saturday, police said. Another person was critically injured in the accident that took place on a stretch of the Dumka-Rampurhat national highway near Simluti village, police added. The deceased include a man and a woman, as per a doctor.

22.title: Woman sedated at house party, gang-raped by guests in Pune
22.article_body: A woman, who had arranged a house party at her residence in Pune on October 9, was reportedly gang-raped by her guests. The woman claimed that after the party, she went to her room to rest, following which the accused entered the room, sprayed sedatives on her and raped her. Police have arrested two persons in the case.

23.title: Wasim Jaffer shares 'Kota Factory' meme to react to Rohit, Babar hugging each other
23.article_body: Former India batter Wasim Jaffer took to Twitter to react to pictures of Team India captain Rohit Sharma and Pakistan captain Babar Azam hugging each other during a photoshoot ahead of T20 World Cup 2022. Reacting to the picture, he shared a meme from the first season of 'Kota Factory', which read, "Kitna parivarik mahol hai (What a familial atmosphere)."

24.title: I am going to 'mankad' someone next year: Rajasthan Royals' Riyan Parag
24.article_body: Rajasthan Royals all-rounder Riyan Parag took to Twitter and stated that he's going to "mankad" someone next year, adding, "It is going to create a fun Twitter debate." Reacting to his tweet, a user wrote, "What if you don't get a chance to be in playing XI?" Parag responded, "Some positivity please...sir." "Ashwin will definitely support you," a fan wrote.

25.title: Wasn't able to perform my duties: Boora Narsaiah Goud after quitting TRS
25.article_body: Former TRS MP Boora Narsaiah Goud, after resigning from the party, alleged that he was not able to perform his duties and was not consulted on the decision to start Bharat Rashtra Samithi (BRS). "I didn't criticise the CM in my resignation letter," Goud said. "I've been through a lot of pain while separating from this family (TRS)," he added.

26.title: Really poor from you: Badani on Starc taking Deepti's name while giving 'mankad' warning
26.article_body: Reacting to a video of Australia pacer Mitchell Starc giving 'mankad' warning to England's Jos Buttler by saying, "I'm not Deepti, but I won't do it",  ex-India cricketer Hemang Badani tweeted, "Grow up Starc...That's really poor from you." He added, "If you only want to warn...non-striker...that's fine...but you bringing Deepti into this isn't what the cricket world expects of you."

27.title: Indian Army signs MoUs with 11 banks for Agniveer Salary Package
27.article_body: The Indian Army has signed Memorandums of Understanding (MoUs) with 11 banks for providing banking facilities to Agniveers under the Agniveer Salary Package. The MoUs were signed with banks including State Bank of India, Punjab National Bank, Bank of Baroda and ICICI Bank. The first batch of Agniveers on enrolment under the 'Agnipath Scheme' will join training centres by January.

28.title: 22-year-old student's body found in drain near Noida college
28.article_body: The body of a 22-year-old student was found in a drain near Galgotias University in Greater Noida on Saturday. The student had been missing since October 12. His family alleged that five students killed him after a fight. There are no apparent injuries on the body of the deceased, said the police. The body has been sent for post-mortem.

29.title: No action by PM on K'taka govt corruption allegation: Siddaramaiah
29.article_body: Congress leader Siddaramaiah said PM Narendra Modi took no action on the letter sent to him by a contractors association accusing the state government of charging 40% commission on public work. "Where are you, Mr Narendra Modi?... Aren't you ashamed?" asked Siddaramaiah. He added that the BJP's only contribution in Karnataka's Ballari was looting natural resources by the mining barons.

30.title: Bodies of 2 children recovered from well in Gujarat; mother missing
30.article_body: The bodies of two minor siblings, whose mother is missing, were recovered from a well in Gujarat's Jamnagar. Police have launched a search operation to trace the missing woman. A case of accidental death was registered after the children's bodies were found. Police suspect the woman may have thrown her five-year-old and three-month-old children in the well.

31.title: 4 including ex-BSP leader's 3 sons booked in gang-rape case in UP
31.article_body: Four people, including three sons of former BSP MLC and mining mafia Haji Iqbal, have been booked in connection with a gang-rape case in Uttar Pradesh, a senior police officer said on Saturday. Iqbal is absconding while his sons are already in jail in different cases, the officer added. The fourth accused was arrested on Saturday.

32.title: Nothing to criticise about Khushi's work in 'The Archies': Boney Kapoor
32.article_body: After watching the teaser of daughter Khushi Kapoor's debut film 'The Archies', producer Boney Kapoor said, "There was nothing to criticise as it was amazing." "We discussed the good points as those were the only things I could see. The same happens when I see Janhvi's films," he added. He also said that Khushi usually doesn't discuss work with him.

33.title: Nadal doesn't look great playing, Federer is smooth, very elegant: Tyson
33.article_body: Boxing legend Mike Tyson has said he's a big fan of Roger Federer, adding when the 20-time Grand Slam champion was in his prime, he was always moving in the air. "Rafael Nadal was just all over the place. He's a great player, but he doesn't look great playing. Federer is smooth and very elegant," he further said.

34.title: Prescribe medicines in Hindi, write Shri Hari on top: MP CM Chouhan
34.article_body: Madhya Pradesh CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan asked why prescriptions cannot be written in Hindi and said doctors should "write Shri Hari on the top and the names of medicines below". He said the government was not against English but awareness about the official language is necessary. He said Indians had become "slaves" to the English language.

35.title: Kerala govt opposes ED plea seeking transfer of gold smuggling case
35.article_body: Kerala government has filed an affidavit in the SC opposing the ED's plea seeking the transfer of trial in the Kerala gold smuggling case to Karnataka. After completion of the investigation and evidence collection, and submission of a supplementary complaint, ED cannot seek transfer of the case merely on the ground of alleged interference by state police, the government argued.

36.title: Arjun Rampal, girlfriend Gabriella to star in 'Project Love': Reports
36.article_body: Actor Arjun Rampal has signed on to star in an upcoming comic caper, titled 'Project Love', according to reports. It will reportedly also feature the actor's girlfriend Gabriella Demetriades. As per reports, the story revolves around a brother who decides to make a plan to kidnap his sister in order to save her from her boyfriend who is an opportunist.

37.title: No unparliamentary language used to question PM's caste: JD(U) chief
37.article_body: JD(U) President Lalan Singh defended his remarks on PM Modi's caste and said he did not use any "unparliamentary language". "What will you call someone who...tries to mislead people by furnishing wrong facts?" asked Singh. He had said that PM Modi claimed to be from the extremely backward class in 2014 even though "Gujarat has no EBC category".

38.title: Patient plays saxophone while undergoing brain surgery in Italy, video surfaces
38.article_body: A musician in Italy who underwent a "very, very complex" brain surgery to remove a tumour, played his saxophone during the nine-hour procedure. The 35-year-old man underwent the 'awake surgery', allowing doctors to check his speech and motor skills to ensure they haven't been damaged. A video showed him playing 'Love Story' movie theme song and the Italian national anthem.

39.title: Jaya says grandson Agastya watches 'Kabhi Khushi...' to make fun of her
39.article_body: Veteran actress Jaya Bachchan, in an episode of her granddaughter Navya Naveli Nanda's podcast 'What The Hell Navya', revealed that her grandson Agastya Nanda watches 'Kabhi Khushi Kabhie Gham' to "make fun" of her in it. The Karan Johar directorial was released in 2001. Agastya is all set to make his acting debut with Zoya Akhtar's upcoming 'The Archies'.

40.title: Murder probe launched after girl's body found in a trunk in Paris
40.article_body: A murder investigation was launched on Saturday following the recovery of a 12-year-old girl's body from a trunk outside her family's building in Paris. According to French media, surveillance footage shows the girl entering the building's lobby at 3 pm (local time) on Friday. Cameras also reportedly show a woman dragging a trunk with some difficulty later in the day.

41.title: My grandfather always told me tennis was boxing at 90 ft: Jimmy Connors
41.article_body: Jimmy Connors revealed that his grandfather trained him as a boxer as part of his tennis training. "My grandfather was a boxer...He always told me...tennis was boxing at 90 feet. Because you had to learn how to take...blows and come back from it," he added. With 109 titles, Connors holds the record for most men's singles titles in Open Era.

42.title: ED raids coaching centre of TMC MLA Manik Bhattacharya's aide
42.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) on Saturday raided a coaching centre owned by Tapas Mondal, a close aide of TMC MLA Manik Bhattacharya, in West Bengal. The raid was conducted in connection with the alleged state SSC recruitment scam case. Bhattacharya was arrested on Tuesday for alleged irregularities in teachers' appointments. He's the ex-President of West Bengal Board of Primary Education.

43.title: Why does India's T20 World Cup 2022 jersey have just one star on it?
43.article_body: India's T20 World Cup 2022 jersey has only one star on it instead of the usual three stars on India's limited-over jersey. The three stars represent India's World Cup wins: 1983 ODI World Cup, 2007 T20 World Cup and 2011 ODI World Cup. The solitary star for the T20 World Cup 2022 represents just India's 2007 T20 World Cup win.

44.title: ICC releases list of 10 records that could be smashed at T20 World Cup 2022
44.article_body: The ICC has released a list of 10 records that could be smashed at T20 World Cup 2022, which begins in Australia tomorrow. The records include Mahela Jayawardena's record for scoring most runs in T20 WC history (1,016), Chris Gayle's record for slamming most T20 WC centuries (two), Virat Kohli's record for registering most scores of 50+ in T20 WC.

45.title: When have we shown aggression?: Imran Khan as US Prez calls Pakistan 'dangerous'
45.article_body: Former Pakistan PM Imran Khan raised questions over the remarks of US President Joe Biden after the latter called Pakistan "one of the most dangerous nations in the world". "On what info has [US President] reached this unwarranted conclusion?" asked Khan. "Unlike the US which has been involved in wars [globally]...when has Pakistan shown aggression, especially post-nuclearisation?" he added.

46.title: AAP, others file complaints against BJP candidate for Adampur bypoll
46.article_body: Adampur bypoll candidates from AAP, INLD and three others filed separate complaints with Haryana's Chief Electoral Officer against BJP's nominee Bhavya Bishnoi. The complainants alleged that Bishnoi hid the details of three out of four cases being investigated by the ED against him. The Returning Officer has reportedly said Bishnoi did not hide any fact in his submissions.

47.title: BJP became world's largest party due of leaders like Madan Lal Khurana: Nadda
47.article_body: BJP chief JP Nadda on Saturday said the party has become the world's largest political party because of leaders like Madan Lal Khurana who never wavered from their ideology and commitment towards people. Nadda asked party leaders and workers to learn from Khurana's life. Khurana was involved in numerous political struggles and provided solutions to different issues, Nadda added.

48.title: Telangana's Nalgonda Congress leader Palle Ravi Kumar joins TRS
48.article_body: Nalgonda Congress leader Palle Ravi Kumar and his wife, Chandur MPP Jyothi, joined TRS on Saturday in the presence of the party's working president KT Rama Rao in Hyderabad. Ravi Kumar was among those trying for a chance as Congress candidate for the Munugode by-election. His brother, Palle Vinod, has filed his nomination as a candidate for Telangana Jana Samithi.

49.title: After 'Delhi Crime 2', my son said I've become like Iron Man: Shefali Shah
49.article_body: Actress Shefali Shah revealed that after 'Delhi Crime 2', her son told her that she has become like Iron Man. "He shared...every Marvel superhero has been played by various actors except Iron Man...you've become like that. You cannot be replaced," she said. "I was so touched that I wanted to print and put it on the walls," Shefali added.

50.title: 2 Arunachal youths go missing from near China border; search op underway
50.article_body: Two youths in Arunachal Pradesh have been reported missing for almost two months after they had ventured near the state's border with China in search of medicinal plants. "Their family members lodged missing complaints before the police on October 9," Anjaw SP Rike Kamsi said. "We have contacted the Army and our search and rescue operations are underway," Kamsi added.

51.title: We don't really have a choice in what people call us: NZ skipper Williamson
51.article_body: Showing no concern about the lack of favourites tag for New Zealand at upcoming T20 World Cup, captain Kane Williamson said his side doesn't really have a choice in what people call them. He added that the team will try and focus on the cricket that they want to play. New Zealand finished as runners-up at T20 World Cup 2021.

52.title: One can become Sub-Inspector in K'taka by paying ₹80 lakh: Rahul
52.article_body: Congress MP Rahul Gandhi on Saturday claimed that if people have money, they can buy a government job in Karnataka. "If you want to be Police Sub-Inspector, you can be one by paying ₹80 lakh," he added. Calling the state government a "40% commission" government, he questioned why 2.5 lakh government posts were lying vacant in the BJP-ruled state.

53.title: Congress' 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' is meaningless: K'taka CM Bommai
53.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai on Saturday said the Congress is relaunching its "failed missile" Rahul Gandhi through 'Bharat Jodo Yatra', but the entire exercise is meaningless. "Already, the country has been marching ahead as a united India," the Karnataka CM said. "India is united, and it is making rapid progress on the international level," Bommai added.

54.title: All 4 will die: Man in live Facebook video before BMW hit truck at 230 kmph in UP
54.article_body: Four persons were killed on the Purvanchal Expressway in Sultanpur, Uttar Pradesh. A BMW car that was going at a high speed of 230 kmph had rammed into a container truck. The occupants of the BMW were doing a Facebook Live, with the camera focused on the speedometer. A man can be heard saying, "All four will die."

55.title: Will never forget smell of cigars & beard glue: Rupert on Robbie's demise
55.article_body: Actor Rupert Grint, who played Ron Weasley in the 'Harry Potter' films, took to Instagram to share a post mourning the demise of Robbie Coltrane, who portrayed Hagrid. "I'll never forget the smell of cigars and beard glue - a wonderful combination," he wrote. "[He was]...a giant-hearted man who was still looking out for us even decades later," Rupert added.

56.title: Judicial delay is a major challenge facing the people: PM Modi
56.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi said delay in getting justice is one of the main challenges being faced by the people. He made the comment in a video message aired at the 'All India Conference of Law Ministers and Law Secretaries' in Kevadia, Gujarat on Saturday. Modi said new laws should be written lucidly so that they are easy to understand.

57.title: Delhi govt launches 6 scholarship programmes for 2022-23
57.article_body: The Delhi Department for Welfare of SC/ST/OBC/Minorities said six scholarship programmes for students of classes XII and below have been launched for the 2022-2023 academic year. Under the programme, the government will reimburse tuition fees of selected students. The department has issued guidelines to all heads of schools regarding the programmes.

58.title: Petrol tanker overturns after crash in UP, hundreds loot petrol; video goes viral
58.article_body: A video has gone viral showing hundreds of local people looting petrol after a petrol tanker overturned in Uttar Pradesh's Aligarh district. The tanker overturned after crashing into a truck following which petrol fell into a ditch. In the video, locals can be seen filling buckets and utensils with petrol.

59.title: Divine spirit attached to film made it a hit: Rishab on Kantara's success
59.article_body: Rishab Shetty, who wrote and directed the Kannada film 'Kantara' in addition to acting in it, spoke about the film's success and said that the "divine spirit and energy attached to the film has made it a blockbuster today". "Also, the people of Karnataka who've promoted the film...and the pride they feel is the reason behind...success of Kantara," he added.

60.title: Mahagathbandhan flag will fly at Centre: Bihar minister Tej Pratap
60.article_body: Bihar minister Tej Pratap Yadav said that the Opposition will replace BJP in the 2024 Lok Sabha polls. "Public has rejected the BJP government in Bihar...Last time, I had predicted about Chachaji (Bihar CM Nitish Kumar), today he is with us," Yadav said. He added, "Today, I predict that the flag of Mahagathbandhan will fly at the Centre."

61.title: Vistara to start Pune-Singapore direct flights from December
61.article_body: Vistara airlines will start direct flights between Pune and Singapore from December 2. "As an introductory offer, the all-inclusive Pune-Singapore-Pune round trip will cost ₹17,799 for economy," said Chief Executive Officer of Vistara, Vinod Kannan. The flight will leave Pune on Mondays, Wednesdays, Fridays and Sundays at 02:10 hours and reach Singapore at 10:30 hours.

62.title: Incorrect measure of hunger: Govt as India falls 6 places on Global Hunger Index
62.article_body: The government issued a statement as the World Hunger Index ranked India at 107th position among 121 countries, six places below last year. "The index is an erroneous measure of hunger and suffers from serious methodological issues," said the government. The Global Hunger Report is 'misinformed' and "disconnected from ground reality", it added, while raising questions over the indicators used.

63.title: Om Prakash Bakoria appointed Chairman & Managing Director of PMPML
63.article_body: Om Prakash Bakoria has been appointed as the Chairman and Managing Director of Pune Mahanagar Parivahan Mahamandal Limited (PMPML). Bakoria earlier served as the Additional Municipal Commissioner of the Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC). In the PMC, Bakoria was involved in several key decisions related to the public transport services, officials said.

64.title: Railways takes up demolition drive in Delhi’s Shakur Basti
64.article_body: Indian Railways demolished around 70 to 80 homes in Northwest Delhi's Shakur Basti on Friday to develop upcoming projects. While locals claimed they were not intimated beforehand of the demolition, a Railways spokesman denied the charge. Pradhan of the settlement, Virendra Kohli, said the houses demolished were home to around 300 to 350 people.

65.title: 67-yr-old businessman abducted in UP's Bulandshahr, case registered
65.article_body: A 67-year-old businessman, identified as Rajkumar, was allegedly abducted when he was out on a morning walk in Uttar Pradesh's Bulandshahr, his family members said on Saturday. Rajkumar runs a hardware business in the district's Khurja city. A case has been registered based on the family's complaint and CCTV footage is being examined, SSP Shlok Kumar said.

66.title: ₹2 cr was illegally levied on coal transportation daily in Chhattisgarh: ED
66.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) has claimed that some officials and politicians in Chhattisgarh used to illegally levy charges on coal transportation, generating about ₹2 crore to ₹3 crore daily. Chhattisgarh IAS officer Sameer Vishnoi and two others were arrested in the case on Thursday. One of the arrested has admitted that he handled the illegally levied sums of money.

67.title: Putin warns of "global catastrophe" if NATO clashes with Russian army
67.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin has warned that any direct clash of NATO troops with Russia could lead to a "global catastrophe". "I hope...those...who are saying this are smart enough not to take such a step," he stated. Putin also claimed he had no regrets about invading Ukraine and that Russia's partial mobilisation of troops should be completed within two weeks.

68.title: Cyberabad Traffic Police book 283 cases for drunk driving
68.article_body: A mega drunk and drive checking was conducted by Cyberabad Traffic Police on Friday night during which 283 cases were registered. Cases were booked against 210 two-wheeler riders, 63 four-wheeler drivers, seven three-wheelers and three heavy vehicles. "Strict action will be taken against those who drive under the influence of alcohol," Cyberabad Police tweeted.

69.title: 2 policemen attacked by village mob in Punjab's Kapurthala
69.article_body: Two police personnel were allegedly attacked by a mob in a village in Punjab's Kapurthala district on Saturday. A feud took place between constable Parminder Singh and a man after the car driven by the former overtook the villager's vehicle, police said. Later, a mob of around 20 people attacked Parminder and another constable Navdeep Singh with swords and sticks.

70.title: ED summons Anubrata's daughter to inquire about her 'huge' wealth
70.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) has summoned the daughter of arrested TMC leader Anubrata Mondal to its headquarters in Delhi on October 27 in connection with the cattle smuggling case. Sukanya Mondal will be interrogated about the source of the "huge" wealth she has amassed in the past few years, an official said. Sukanya is a school teacher in West Bengal.

71.title: Death toll from coal mine explosion in Turkey reaches 41
71.article_body: The death toll from a coal mine explosion in Turkey's Bartin province on Friday has risen to 41, Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan said on Saturday. Earlier, Turkey's Interior Minister said 58 of the 110 people working in the mine were either rescued or got out by themselves. The explosion is believed to have been caused by a methane build-up.

72.title: 140 exotic animals & birds smuggled from Myanmar rescued in Mizoram
72.article_body: Mizoram Police, in a joint operation with the Excise and Narcotics Department, rescued 140 exotic animals and birds in Champhai. The animals, including 30 tortoises, 55 crocodile hatchlings and 22 pythons, are suspected to have been smuggled from Myanmar. As per reports, police arrested three persons in this connection and intercepted three vehicles.

73.title: Father figure for me was somebody on phone: Ali Fazal on parents' divorce
73.article_body: Actor Ali Fazal said that his parents got divorced when he was in Class 12, and the father figure for him was somebody on the phone. "It had become a system that once or twice in a year, we had to go and meet him," he said. "I've nothing against him. But it had become transactionary," he added.

74.title: My strengths helped me a lot: Deepti on winning Player of the Tournament award
74.article_body: After being adjudged 'Player of the Tournament' in Women's Asia Cup, India all-rounder Deepti Sharma said she just backs her strengths and that helped her a lot in Sylhet. "The wickets were slow and before this tournament, I worked a lot on my batting and those sessions really helped me," she added. Deepti scored 94 runs and took 13 wickets.

75.title: China reserves right to use force over Taiwan: CCP spokesperson
75.article_body: China reserves the right to use force over Taiwan as the last resort in compelling circumstances, however, a peaceful reunification is Beijing's first choice, a Chinese Communist Party (CCP) spokesperson said on Saturday. The reunification of China and Taiwan is in the interest of everyone, including Taiwan compatriots, CCP spokesperson Sun Yeli told a news conference in Beijing.

76.title: Hope Dybala, Di Maria recover from their injuries before WC: Messi
76.article_body: Argentinian skipper Lionel Messi said that he hopes that two of the team members namely Angel Di Maria and Paulo Dybala recover from their injuries before the start of the FIFA World Cup. "It's (injuries) a concern because it's a different WC...[and] we're so close that any little thing that can happen to you can leave you out," Messi said.

77.title: Large amounts of nutrients not good for Bengaluru's Uttarahalli Lake: Expert
77.article_body: According to an expert, the presence of a large quantity of nutrients in Bengaluru's Uttarahalli Lake is not good and the Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike should take up bio-remediation measures. "Eutrophication happens when large amounts of nutrients enter...due to sewage...[and lake's] catfishes were also noticed gasping for air," the expert said. Notably, Uttarahalli Lake spans 15.16 acres.

78.title: 2 people who went fishing die due to lightning in Thane
78.article_body: Two people from Chiradpada village in Thane's Bhiwandi reportedly died due to lightning and heavy rains on Friday evening. They were returning home from fishing at the Bhatsa river when the lightning struck them, a Regional Disaster Management Cell (RDMC) official said. While two persons died on the spot, two others were injured in the incident, the official added.

79.title: Talented teammates will give Neymar great support at WC: Ronaldo
79.article_body: Ahead of the upcoming FIFA World Cup, Ex-Brazil footballer Ronaldo said that the current set of players will give Neymar the best supporting cast he has ever had with the Brazilian national team. "This is definitely a better team than the ones Brazil had in the last three WCs. But the responsibility always lies with the biggest star," Ronaldo said.

80.title: Man arrested for attacking priest, pelting stones at Thane ashram
80.article_body: A 35-year-old man has been arrested in Thane for allegedly attacking a priest with a knife at an ashram in the city. The accused, who was in an inebriated state, pelted stones at the ashram and attacked the 63-year-old priest when questioned by him. A man present at the ashram intervened and snatched the knife from the accused.

81.title: Woman leaves note calling Putin 'serial killer' on his parents' grave in Russia
81.article_body: A 60-year-old woman has been detained in Russia for allegedly leaving a note calling Russian President Vladimir Putin a "serial killer" and wishing for his death. Irina Tsybaneva faces five years in jail for leaving the note which reportedly said, "Parents of a serial killer, take him with you." The note added, "You raised a freak and a killer."

82.title: Who are the past winners of T20 World Cup?
82.article_body: Australia are the defending T20 World Cup champions. India won inaugural edition in 2007. Pakistan, who were runners-up in 2007, won their maiden title in 2009, beating Sri Lanka in the final. England won the 2010 edition, while Sri Lanka won the 2014 edition. West Indies have won T20 World Cup the most number of times (twice: 2012 and 2016).

83.title: Kerala Guv Arif Mohammed Khan's FB account hacked; police informed
83.article_body: Kerala Governor Arif Mohammed Khan's Facebook account was hacked on Saturday, police said. "The matter has been reported and efforts are on to restore the page," Khan said, according to the Kerala Rajbhavan PRO. As per reports, there are three posts on the account that show hardware or construction-related videos, along with descriptions of the same in Arabic script.

84.title: It's an Indian spy-thriller without bikinis & six packs: Karthi on 'Sardar'
84.article_body: Actor Karthi, while speaking about his upcoming film 'Sardar', said, "People keep asking me if 'Sardar' is touted to be a James Bond film, will it have bikini scenes and six packs?" He added that it is an Indian spy-thriller without bikinis and six packs. "So, it is for all family audiences," Karthi further said.

85.title: We should give credit to bowlers: Harmanpreet on India's Asia Cup win
85.article_body: Following India's eight-wicket win against Sri Lanka in Women's Asia Cup final, India skipper Harmanpreet Kaur said, "We should give credit to the bowlers and the fielding unit was very good today from ball one." Renuka Singh's 3/5 in three overs and Sneh Rana and Rajeshwari Gayakwad's two wickets each helped India restrict Sri Lanka to 65/9.

86.title: 2 people die after motorcycles collide in UP's Bijnor
86.article_body: Two persons were killed and as many injured in a collision between two motorcycles in the Rehar area in Bijnor, Uttar Pradesh on Saturday. The deceased, Alauddin (20) and Shekhar (19), were riding their respective motorcycles and died on the spot, police said. The incident happened at around 2 pm in front of Inter College Bhaguwala, police added.

87.title: T20 retirement not on my mind, it's a format I love playing: Finch
87.article_body: Australian skipper Aaron Finch said that he hasn't thought about retiring from the T20 format. "To retire from ODI cricket was quite nice. I think it took a little bit of weight off my shoulders," Finch said. The 35-year-old batter added, "But haven't even had it cross my mind about the T20 format. It's a format that I love playing."

88.title: IED weighing around 18 kg detected & destroyed in J&K's Bandipora
88.article_body: Security forces detected and destroyed an improvised explosive device (IED) in J&K's Bandipora district on Saturday. The IED, weighing around 18 kg and fitted with two gas cylinders, was found in close proximity to the Bandipora-Sopore road, according to officials. A joint search operation had been launched in the area based on intelligence received from the police, the army informed.

89.title: Was told 'Why're you dancing? Look after the house': Madhuri on becoming mother
89.article_body: Actress Madhuri Dixit in an interview spoke about how society's perception of her changed after she got married and became a mother. She said, "These things happen...there are many who say 'Now you're a mom, why are you dancing? You please sit, look after the house'." However, Madhuri added that none of these things ever bothered her.

90.title: Unidentified persons booked for duping Gurugram man of ₹4 lakh
90.article_body: Police have booked unidentified persons for allegedly defrauding a resident of Gurugram's Sushant Lok Phase-I. According to police, Satvinder Singh Tanwar deposited ₹4 lakh into three different bank accounts after he received what he believed to be a request for monetary help from his US-based friend over WhatsApp. Tanwar later learned that his friend's WhatsApp account had been hacked.

91.title: Champions of Asia: Jaffer on India's record 7th title in Women's Asia Cup
91.article_body: Reacting to India winning a record-extending seventh title in Women's Asia Cup, Wasim Jaffer took to Twitter and wrote, "Champions of Asia. Congratulations." He added, "To win seven out of the last eight Asia Cups is absolute domination." Virat Kohli tweeted, "Way to go." Chasing 66, India scored 71/2 in 8.3 overs to defeat Sri Lanka in the final.

92.title: 2 arrested in Mumbai for robbing ₹10 lakh by posing as CBI officers
92.article_body: The Mumbai Crime Branch arrested a hospital ward boy and a tiffin supplier for allegedly posing as CBI officials and robbing a 70-year-old man of ₹10 lakh. Police have recovered ₹3.25 lakh from the duo and are on the lookout for their three accomplices. The accused accosted the victim at a bus stop and took his bag containing the amount.

93.title: Mallikarjun Kharge joins Bharat Jodo Yatra in Karnataka's Ballari
93.article_body: Congress Presidential candidate Mallikarjun Kharge joined Rahul Gandhi and other leaders in the Bharat Jodo Yatra while it was crossing Karnataka's Ballari district. Kharge also took part in the mega public meeting in the district to celebrate the yatra reaching the 1,000-km milestone. The yatra will exit Karnataka on October 20 after covering 511 km in 21 days.

94.title: 3.4 kg gold worth ₹1.7 cr seized at Kerala's Kozhikode airport
94.article_body: A total of 3.4 kg of gold, worth ₹1.7 crore, was seized and two passengers who arrived at Kerala's Kozhikode airport were arrested, according to DRI officials. The gold was concealed in the body of the passengers who arrived from Doha, officials added. "The officers, acting on the information, mounted surveillance...and [arrested] both the carriers," a DRI statement said.

95.title: I'm happy being single: Rajev on reports saying he got married for 2nd time
95.article_body: Actor Rajev Paul, ex-husband of actress Delnaaz Irani, has dismissed reports that claimed he has tied the knot again. Reports surfaced after the actor shared a picture on Instagram where he could be seen dressed as a groom. Stating that it was a wedding sequence from his show, Rajev said, "I'm happy being single and don't want to get married."

96.title: Crops damaged due to unseasonal rains: Agriculture Minister
96.article_body: Agriculture Minister Narendra Singh Tomar on Saturday said that unseasonal rains have damaged crops. "The survey is underway and we are waiting for reports from the states to assess the extent of damage," Tomar said. Farmers are dependent on monsoon, which is unpredictable, he said, adding that despite all measures in place, cultivators are at the mercy of nature.

97.title: Eateries in Bengaluru can stay open till 1 am: Police Commissioner
97.article_body: After receiving multiple complaints about policemen forcing eateries in Bengaluru to shut by 11 pm, city Police Commissioner Pratap Reddy has issued an order allowing them to remain open until 1 am throughout the week. He has directed the police personnel to follow the government order issued in 2016 that allows eateries to operate between 6 am and 1 am.

98.title: Shami's estranged wife Hasin accuses TTE of misbehaving with her during train journey
98.article_body: Team India fast bowler Mohammad Shami's estranged wife Hasin Jahan has accused a TTE of misbehaving with her while she was travelling on a train from Kolkata to Bihar. She stated that the TTE used abusive language and also threw her mobile away. "Later I took help from the police and returned to the city under security escorts," she added.

99.title: Twitter user calls Big B 'weakest link' of 'Chupke Chupke', Dharmendra reacts
99.article_body: Veteran actor Dharmendra responded to a fan who tweeted that Amitabh Bachchan was "the weakest link" of 1975 movie 'Chupke Chupke'. The fan had reacted to a critic who, in an opinion piece, said Amitabh was "so nuanced and natural" in the film. "Stop running down Dharmendra for someone else's PR," the fan added. Dharmendra responded, "So sweet. Love you."

100.title: SC rejects Meta's plea against CCI probe into WhatsApp's privacy policy
100.article_body: The Supreme Court has dismissed Meta's pleas challenging the investigation ordered by the Competition Commission of India (CCI) into WhatsApp's updated privacy policy of 2021. "The CCI is an independent authority to consider any violation of the provisions of the Competition Act of 2002...[and] cannot be dissuaded from investigation," a bench of Justices MR Shah and Sudhanshu Dhulia said.

101.title: It's not all doom and gloom for us: SA captain Bavuma ahead of T20 WC
101.article_body: South Africa captain Temba Bavuma said his side is looking forward to T20 World Cup 2022 and how far they can go in Australia. "It's not all doom and gloom for us. We're excited...Probably not a lot of expectations around us as a team again," he added. South Africa have never reached the T20 World Cup final so far.

102.title: New ad features Ranbir Kapoor, Ananya Panday as a couple; fans call out their age gap
102.article_body: An advertisement featuring 40-year-old Ranbir Kapoor and 23-year-old Ananya Panday as a couple has been called out by fans over their age difference. "Entire ad I was waiting for a twist to show their relationship anything other than romantic," wrote a person. "I can't get over the glaring age difference," another comment read. However, some fans appreciated the pair's chemistry.

103.title: Stray dog mauls 3-year-old girl to death, injures others in Odisha
103.article_body: A three-year-old girl playing outside her house was mauled by a stray dog in Odisha's Balangir on Thursday. Deepa Munda died while undergoing treatment at a hospital. Reports claimed the dog bit her head and face, following which it attacked more than five people. Locals claimed it injured at least 12 people. Police said the animal hasn't been traced yet.

104.title: Congress' job is to create quarrels among people: Amit Shah
104.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah, while addressing the people of Himachal Pradesh, criticised the Congress and said that the party's job is to create quarrels among people. "Himachal Pradesh is going to set a new custom that is 'ek baar BJP, baar baar BJP'…Congress cannot sit in peace without creating enmity among the people," said Shah.

105.title: Elephant found dead in forest in Chhattisgarh's Raigarh
105.article_body: An elephant was found dead in a forest near Khentabahari village in Chhattisgarh's Raigarh district. The carcass was found under Chhal range on Friday evening and a post-mortem was underway to find the cause of death, an official said. Notably, Chhattisgarh has reported 45 elephant deaths in the last four years. The causes range from ailments and age to electrocution.

106.title: Man impersonates Indian Air Force Wing Commander at Delhi Airport; arrested
106.article_body: A man was arrested for allegedly impersonating an Indian Air Force Wing Commander at Delhi Airport on Saturday. The accused, Feroz Gandhi, is a resident of East Delhi. An entry passport issued in 2016, through which he had been getting easy entry at the airport, was recovered from him. Several incriminating documents regarding Air Force were recovered from his home.

107.title: Nitish Kumar's boat collides with pillar in Ganga river in Bihar, CM safe
107.article_body: Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar's boat collided with a pillar of JP Setu in Ganga river in the state on Saturday. The incident took place when the CM was inspecting ghats in Patna for the upcoming Chhath festival. Kumar and other people who were onboard the boat were safe after the accident, ANI reported. The boat sustained no significant damage.

108.title: Iran denies providing weapons to Russia to be used in Ukraine
108.article_body: Iranian Foreign Minister Hossein Amirabdollahian said Iran hasn't supplied Russia with weapons to be used in the Ukraine war. "We've defence cooperation with Russia, but our policy on...Ukraine war is against sending weapons to the conflicting sides and support an end to the war," he added. Ukraine has claimed that Iranian drones were used in Russian attacks in several cities.

109.title: Expired drug kills 10 child leukaemia patients in Yemen
109.article_body: At least 10 children being treated for leukaemia have died after being administered expired doses of cancer treatment in Yemen's Houthi rebel-held capital Sanaa, medical officials and workers said. The medication was reportedly smuggled into the country. Yemen's conflict, now entering its eighth year, has caused one of the world's worst humanitarian crises and has killed over 1,50,000 people.

110.title: K'taka govt fined ₹2,900 cr by NGT for failure to manage solid, liquid waste
110.article_body: The National Green Tribunal has imposed a penalty of ₹2,900 crore on the Karnataka government for failure to manage solid as well as liquid waste. "The total compensation comes to ₹3,396 crore…We have deducted the amount of ₹500 crore levied as compensation vide order dated October 10," said the Tribunal in a statement.

111.title: Sweden rejects joint investigation into Nord Stream leaks
111.article_body: Sweden has rejected plans for formal joint investigation with Denmark and Germany to look into gas leaks at the Nord Stream 1 and 2 pipelines citing national security concerns, according to a Swedish prosecutor. Mats Ljungqvist said a joint investigation would include legal agreements under which Sweden would have to share information from its own investigation that it deemed confidential.

112.title: BMC takes up responsibility of cleaning hospitals, to spend ₹74 cr
112.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) has taken up the responsibility of cleaning hospitals for which it will outsource the cleaning work at seven civic-run hospitals to private agencies. The estimated cost of the project is ₹74 crore. "The paan stains on walls and trash dumped in the open have been a major challenge to cleanliness," a civic official said.

113.title: Indian economy projected to grow at 7% in FY23 despite global headwinds: FM
113.article_body: Indian economy is projected to grow at 7% in the current fiscal despite global headwinds, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said. This is an outcome of the conducive domestic policy environment and the government's focus on key structural reforms, she said. "India is leading the world in terms of digital payments innovations with our transaction cost being the lowest," she stated.

114.title: 23 noise pollution hotspots identified across Delhi
114.article_body: The Delhi Pollution Control Committee (DPCC) has identified 23 locations across the city as noise pollution hotspots, according to a report submitted to the National Green Tribunal (NGT). The 'hotspots' were identified on the basis of real-time noise monitoring data assessed at 31 locations. Jahangirpuri, Karol Bagh, Kashmere Gate, and Anand Vihar are among the locations on DPCC's hotspot list.

115.title: Finch surprises Babar with birthday cake at T20 WC captains' presser, ICC shares video
115.article_body: The ICC has shared a video showing Australia captain Aaron Finch surprising Pakistan captain Babar Azam with a birthday cake during the T20 World Cup 2022 captains' press conference. In the video, Babar, who turned 28 today, can be seen cutting the cake as captains of the other 15 teams, including Rohit Sharma watched on.

116.title: Defending champions Australia are favourites for T20 WC 2022: Buttler
116.article_body: Talking about upcoming T20 World Cup 2022 in Australia, England captain Jos Buttler stated that the defending champions Australia are the favourites for the tournament. He said that the host nation are "slight favourites" in big tournaments as they know conditions better than any other team. Australia will play against New Zealand in their first match on October 22.

117.title: Varun criticises UP govt for not postponing UPSSSC PET amid floods
117.article_body: BJP MP Varun Gandhi has criticised Uttar Pradesh government, saying that despite demands, UPSSSC Preliminary Eligibility Test (PET) wasn't postponed nor were adequate transport arrangements made for students to reach exam centres amid floods in the state. He also shared photos of crowds in trains and at railway stations. "'Ground realities' are perhaps not visible from 'aerial surveys'," he added.

118.title: GHMC officials to inspect eateries in Hyderabad to curb adulteration
118.article_body: The Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation (GHMC) will form teams of Food Safety Officers, Assistant Medical Officers of Health (AMOH) and veterinary officials and conduct inspections at eateries to curb adulteration of food. GHMC Mayor Vijayalaxmi Gadwal warned that officials will be held responsible if adulterated food is sold. She asked officials to submit reports on inspections conducted.

119.title: IFS officer shares screenshot of fake job offer for '₹9,700 salary', warns people
119.article_body: IFS officer Parveen Kaswan tweeted a screenshot of a fake job offer he received via SMS. "Finally got the job offer. Now confused what to do," he joked while sharing the screenshot that read, "Salary is ₹9,700." "These days many fraudulent...agencies keep sending these kinds of SMS...Don't...click on the links. It can lead to data theft...or financial fraud," Kaswan added.

120.title: Kohli keeps on practising despite being told his time is up, video of reaction goes viral
120.article_body: Former Team India captain Virat Kohli kept on practising in the nets despite being told by a support staff member that his time is up. A video has gone viral showing Kohli's reaction on being asked to stop the practice. In the video, Kohli can be heard saying, "When Deepak Hooda will come, I will leave."

121.title: UK-based woman cheats people of ₹9.60 crore; arrested in Mumbai
121.article_body: A UK-based woman was arrested in Mumbai for allegedly cheating multiple people to the tune of around ₹9.60 crore. The accused, Nisha Dusara (34), was named in various cases of fraud across different police stations. However, the one filed in Malad in July this year helped police catch her, in which she had cheated two people of ₹72 lakh.

122.title: Germany made a mistake by siding with NATO in Ukraine war: Putin
122.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin has said that Germany made a mistake by siding with NATO in the Ukraine war. Putin said that the decision to cancel the Nord Stream 2 pipeline was a German one. "German citizens, businesses and its economy are paying for this mistake, because it has negative economic consequences for the Eurozone as a whole," he added.

123.title: PM Modi pays tribute to APJ Abdul Kalam on his 91st birth anniversary
123.article_body: PM Narendra Modi paid tribute to the country’s former President APJ Abdul Kalam on his 91st birth anniversary and recalled his contributions. "He is greatly admired for his contribution to our nation as a scientist and as a President who struck a chord with every section of society," tweeted PM Modi. He was born in Tamil Nadu's Rameswaram in 1931.

124.title: Reserved category certificate not mandatory for seeking govt jobs: Raj CM
124.article_body: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot approved a proposal allowing candidates from reserved categories to apply for government jobs even if they don't possess a certificate. Those belonging to other backward class (OBC), most backward class (MBC) or economically weaker section (EWS) can apply by submitting an affidavit if they don't have a certificate due to any reason, an order stated.

125.title: 20,874 cattle infected with lumpy skin disease in MP, 336 dead
125.article_body: As many as 20,874 cattle have got infected with lumpy skin disease across 31 districts of Madhya Pradesh till October 13, an official said on Saturday. Out of the total infected, 336 animals died, while 18,351 have recovered, added the official. Dhar, Betul, Morena, Ratlam, Ujjain and Khandwa are among the worst-hit districts, said officials.

126.title: Russian reservists likely buying their own body armour: UK
126.article_body: UK's Defence Ministry said that many Russian reservists called up to fight in Ukraine are probably having to buy their own body armour. The "modern 6B45 vest" was selling online in Russia for $638, over triple its price since April, it added. "Endemic corruption and poor logistics remain one of the...causes of Russia's poor performance in Ukraine," it further said.

127.title: World no. 1 Swiatek reaches her 11th semi-final of 2022 at San Diego Open
127.article_body: World number one Iga Swiatek reached her 11th semi-final of the season after defeating American Coco Gauff 6-0, 6-3 in San Diego Open quarter-final. The victory is Swiatek's 62nd of the season and 40th on hard court. The 21-year-old will face fourth-seeded Jessie Pegula in Saturday's semi-final. Swiatek has won seven titles, including two Grand Slams, in 2022 so far.

128.title: Bengaluru-bound Akasa Air flight suffers bird hit, returns safely to Mumbai
128.article_body: Bengaluru-bound Akasa Air Boeing 737MAX that took off from Mumbai returned to its origin after a burning smell was reported in the cabin. It underwent an inspection after landing, during which it was found that the burning smell was caused due to bird hit, a DGCA official said. Bird remains were also found on engine number one, the official added.

129.title: D-Mart operator Avenue Supermarts' Q2 net profit rises 64% to ₹685 cr
129.article_body: Avenue Supermarts Limited, which owns and operates the retail chain D-Mart reported a 64% surge in consolidated profit to ₹685 crore for the quarter ended September as against ₹418 crore in the year-ago period. Its revenue increased by 36% to ₹10,638 crore as against ₹7,789 crore in September 2021 quarter. Avenue Supermarts' total expenses stood at ₹9,925.95 crore, up 36.93%.

130.title: BJP jokers will now call Global Hunger Index report anti-Indian: KTR
130.article_body: TRS leader KT Rama Rao criticised the BJP-led central government over the latest Global Hunger Index report, which showed a deterioration in India's performance. "Yet another amazing achievement of 'NPA Govt'. India slipped from 101st to 107th rank in Global Hunger Index. Instead of accepting failure, [I] am sure BJP jokers will dismiss the report as anti-Indian now," he tweeted.

131.title: 4 booked for cheating doctor in Thane, taking over hospital illegally
131.article_body: Four persons have been booked for allegedly cheating a 79-year-old doctor and taking over his hospital using fabricated documents in Thane, police said on Saturday. The complainant, who retired as a medical officer in 2002, established a hospital in Kalwa and decided to rent it out, police added. The accused fabricated documents and started operating the facility illegally, they said.

132.title: Salman Khan, Katrina Kaif's 'Tiger 3' delayed, to release on Diwali 2023
132.article_body: Salman Khan took to Twitter on Saturday to announce the new release date of 'Tiger 3'. The film, which was previously set to release on April 21, 2023, will now arrive in theatres during Diwali next year. Directed by Maneesh Sharma, it will also feature Katrina Kaif. 'Tiger 3' will be released in Hindi, Tamil and Telugu.

133.title: Modi added his caste to OBC list while he was CM of Gujarat: Lalan Singh
133.article_body: JD(U) National President Lalan Singh has claimed that PM Narendra Modi belongs to a "backward" caste and also accused him of duplicity. "PM Modi projected himself from the Extremely Backward Class (EBC) caste. I want to tell you that there is no EBC in Gujarat. When he became Gujarat's CM, he merged his caste into the OBC," said Singh.

134.title: Pune's Shivajinagar records 74.3 mm of rain in less than 2 hrs: IMD
134.article_body: Pune's Shivajinagar recorded 78.1 mm of rainfall between 8.30 am and 8.30 pm, with 74.3 mm between 4 pm and 5.30 pm on Friday, IMD said. Pashan, Magarpatta, Lavale and Chinchwad recorded 48.4 mm, 36.5 mm, 30.5 mm and 8.7 mm of rainfall, respectively, IMD added. Several parts of Pune witnessed water-logging and traffic jams following intense rainfall on Friday.

135.title: People like Rahul Gandhi will always remain unemployed: BJP MLA
135.article_body: BJP MLA CT Ravi on Friday stated that people like Congress MP Rahul Gandhi will always remain unemployed. The National General Secretary of BJP added, "Congress has lost all the states under...[Rahul Gandhi's] leadership." Ravi further said that the 52-year-old leader "must try some other country" as he'll not be able to relaunch himself in India through 'Bharat Jodo Yatra'.

136.title: Mumbai-based journalist manhandled by policeman in Kurla
136.article_body: A city-based journalist was allegedly manhandled by a traffic police personnel following an argument in Kurla, Mumbai on Friday. The journalist complained to the traffic cop near the railway station about the difficulty in hailing an auto rickshaw which led to an altercation between the two, an official said. Notably, a non-cognisable offence was registered at the Kurla Police Station.

137.title: UK police charge activists who threw soup at Van Gogh's $84 mn painting
137.article_body: Two women climate activists have been charged with criminal damage after throwing tomato soup over Vincent van Gogh's painting 'Sunflowers' at London's National Gallery, UK police said on Saturday. The Friday incident had caused minor damage to the frame but the painting was unharmed, the gallery said. The painting is estimated to be worth over $84 million.

138.title: List of cricketers who checked-in at NCA for injury rehab surfaces, Kohli doesn't feature
138.article_body: A list has surfaced online showing Team India cricketers who checked-in at NCA for injury rehab in the last one year. Ex-Team India captain Virat Kohli is one of the senior cricketers who doesn't feature on the list. The list includes Rohit Sharma, Hardik Pandya, Ravindra Jadeja, KL Rahul, Rishabh Pant, Ajinkya Rahane, Cheteshwar Pujara and Mohammad Shami, among others.

139.title: ICC names 'most explosive batters' who will feature in T20 World Cup 2022
139.article_body: ICC, on its official website, named the "most explosive batters" who will feature in T20 World Cup 2022. The list includes India's Suryakumar Yadav, who has a T20I strike rate of 176.81. Suryakumar is followed by New Zealand's Jimmy Neesham and Finn Allen, Australia's Tim David, West Indies' Evin Lewis, and South Africa's Rilee Rossouw and Aiden Markram, among others.

140.title: 15-yr-old Jaipur girl attempts suicide after blackmail by rapists
140.article_body: A 15-year-old girl in Rajasthan's Jaipur tried to end her life in order to escape the blackmail by her rapists. The girl was first raped by a man and later blackmailed into being sexually assaulted by four other persons known to him. The rapist further blackmailed her into paying ₹50,000 to not release video clips of the assault.

141.title: Several parts of Pune to face disruption in water supply tomorrow
141.article_body: Several parts of Pune will face a disruption in water supply tomorrow due to maintenance and repair work on the water pipeline between Parvati and Cantonment. The city's civic body's water department head Aniruddha Pawaskar said that leakage had been found in the water pipeline and it's necessary to repair it. Areas like Yerawada, Hadapsar, Mundhwa, etc will be affected.

142.title: Section 144 to be imposed in Hyd for TSPSC Group 1 exams on Sunday
142.article_body: Section 144 of the CrPC will be imposed in areas around centres conducting Telangana State Public Service Commission (TSPSC) Group 1 exams across Hyderabad and Secunderabad on Sunday. The curfew will be in effect from 6:00 am on Sunday to 6:00 am on Monday. Assembly of four or more people within 500 yards of the centres will be prohibited.

143.title: Military mobilisation should be finished in 2 weeks: Russian President
143.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin has said that 2,22,000 out of 3,00,000 reservists have already been mobilised and all mobilisation activities will be finished in two weeks. Defending his decision to mobilise Russians, Putin said the front line was too long to defend solely with contract soldiers. Putin added that so far, Russia has no plans to launch massive air strikes.

144.title: Team India will prepare more while facing SL than WI: Irfan on T20 WC
144.article_body: Irfan Pathan said Team India will prepare more while facing Sri Lanka in comparison to West Indies during the T20 World Cup 2022. "The quality of the Sri Lankan side is much better compared to West Indies...Recently, they've beaten India in the Asia Cup," added Irfan. Gautam Gambhir termed Sri Lanka as a team that's peaking at the right time.

145.title: I hope Suryakumar becomes X-factor for India: Rohit ahead of T20 WC
145.article_body: Speaking about Suryakumar Yadav ahead of T20 World Cup, India captain Rohit Sharma said the batter is in good form. "I hope he continues to bat in that way, high on confidence. He's a confident player...plays fearlessly...uses his skill set efficiently. I hope he becomes the X-factor," he added. India will play their first match against Pakistan on October 23.

146.title: Woman accused in constable's murder during 2020 riots arrested from Noida
146.article_body: A 27-year-old woman, an accused in Delhi Police head constable Ratan Lal's murder during the 2020 Northeast Delhi riots, has been arrested from Noida after two years. The woman had fled her home after being named a suspect in the case, police said. "We found that she had moved to Noida and got married recently," police added.

147.title: HDFC Bank's Q2 net profit rises 22.3% to ₹11,125 cr, revenue up 18.3%
147.article_body: HDFC Bank reported a 22.3% surge in consolidated net profit at ₹11,125 crore in the quarter ended September as against ₹9,096.19 crore in the year-ago period. This was led by a 23% loan growth. HDFC Bank's net revenue rose by 18.3% to ₹28,869.8 crore for the said quarter from ₹24,409.7 crore in the corresponding period in the previous financial year.

148.title: Heavy rains cause flooding in Pune, residents blame Smart City plan
148.article_body: Several parts of Pune, including Deccan, Fergusson College Road, Jangli Maharaj Road and Apte Road reported flooding after the city received heavy rains on Friday. Blaming the Smart City plan for waterlogging, a resident said, "Footpaths are not built high enough at low-lying areas." "Authorities sealed many drainage lines as part of the Pune Smart City plan," another citizen added.

149.title: What are the rates at which employees are leaving India's top IT companies?
149.article_body: Infosys has reported an attrition rate of 27.1% for the July to September quarter, the highest among top IT companies in India. While attrition at HCL Tech remained at 23.8%, TCS reported a higher rate of 21.5% and Wipro posted a marginal fall to 23% compared to previous quarter. Attrition rate measures how many employees are voluntarily leaving a company.

150.title: Gurugram residents to be fined ₹500 for not segregating household waste
150.article_body: Residents who do not segregate their household waste before handing it over to the sanitation workers will be fined ₹500 from October 20, Municipal Corporation of Gurugram has announced. The ward-level teams will be conducting targeted and random inspections to find the violators. Residents are expected to segregate the biodegradable, dry and rejected sanitary waste into three separate bins.

151.title: Pakistani female DJ says she got rape, death threats after performing at music festival
151.article_body: Pakistani female DJ Neha Khan has recently revealed that she received rape and death threats after performing at Hunza Music festival last year. She had performed with five male artists at the festival. Neha said that she and her team were accused of sabotaging the local culture and the national norms of the Hunza valley, reports stated while quoting her.

152.title: Robbie Coltrane was like the most fun uncle I've ever had: Emma Watson
152.article_body: Mourning the demise of her 'Harry Potter' co-star Robbie Coltrane, Emma Watson wrote on Instagram Stories, "Robbie was like the most fun uncle I've ever had." The actress, who played the role of Hermione in the 'Harry Potter' films, added, "I'll really miss your sweetness, your nicknames, your warmth, laughs and...hugs. You made us a family...There was no better Hagrid."

153.title: Russell's viper snake found at police station in Hyderabad, rescued
153.article_body: A Russell's viper snake was found at Bahadurpura Police Station in Hyderabad on Saturday morning. The venomous reptile was caught by a volunteer of non-profit organisation 'Friends of Snakes Society'. The volunteer said the snake might have come out from the Musi River or the nearby zoo due to rains. The snake will be released in the deep forest.

154.title: India's forex reserves rise for 1st time in over 2 months by $204 mn
154.article_body: India's foreign exchange reserves rose for the first time in over two months by $204 million to $532.867 billion for the week ending October 7, the RBI data showed. The rise can be attributed to a surge in gold reserves by $1.35 billion to $38.955 billion. The Special Drawing Rights (SDRs) reserve also rose by $155 million to $17.582 billion.

155.title: Cong will get full majority in Himachal Pradesh Assembly polls: Alka Lamba
155.article_body: Congress leader Alka Lamba has exuded confidence that the party will win the upcoming Assembly elections in Himachal Pradesh. "We are very confident that Congress will get a full majority. We appeal to all the citizens of the state to think and vote with contemplation because it is a matter of their as well as the state's future," said Lamba.

156.title: India defeat Sri Lanka to win Women's Asia Cup for a record-extending 7th time
156.article_body: India defeated Sri Lanka by eight wickets in the final in Sylhet to win Women's Asia Cup for a record-extending seventh time. Bowling first after losing the toss, India restricted Sri Lanka to 65/9. India chased down the target in 8.3 overs. India's seven Women's Asia Cup victories include four in ODI format and three in T20I format.

157.title: Salman Khan's fan says Sona Mohapatra has a 'eunuch's face', singer responds
157.article_body: Sona Mohapatra, who called out a channel for roping in Sajid Khan on 'Bigg Boss 16', has been trolled by a Salman Khan fan who said she has a "eunuch's face". "Getting d***s hard, might be...job of...women supporting...#SajidKhan and riding horses in #Salman Bhai's farmhouse, not mine," she replied. Sona had earlier criticised Salman over Sajid's participation in the show.

158.title: Aus are favourites for WC, floor gap between them, other teams: Shastri
158.article_body: Ex-India head coach Ravi Shastri said Australia will be favourites for the T20 World Cup 2022, adding that there's "no question" about that. "I will put them...then there will be a floor gap and then you can start talking about...other teams," he stated. "The span has been...just about 12 months since they won the World Cup," said Shastri.

159.title: MSRTC to run 1,500 extra buses during Diwali in Maharashtra
159.article_body: The Maharashtra State Road Transport Corporation (MSRTC) has decided to operate around 1,500 extra buses from October 21 to October 31 across the state to cater to the rush of commuters during Diwali. Those above 75 years of age can travel free on any state transport bus and those between 65 and 75 will get a 50% concession.

160.title: Revised guidelines issued for development programme in Hyderabad
160.article_body: The Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation (GHMC) has issued revised guidelines after the Telangana government increased the Constituency Development Fund (CDF) from ₹3 crore to ₹5 crore. This amount is provided to MLAs and MLCs for the development of their respective constituencies. As per the revised guidelines, the payment for development work will be done by the District Collector.

161.title: K'taka HC allows cab aggregators to operate autos until govt fixes fares
161.article_body: The Karnataka High Court has allowed app-based cab aggregators including Ola, Uber and Rapido to operate autos until the state government fixes fares. The companies can temporarily charge 10% of base fare as a convenience fee along with 5% of GST. The interim decision comes against the state government's directive which asked ride-hailing apps to discontinue auto services in Bengaluru.

162.title: Russia trying to kill Starlink internet service in Ukraine: Musk
162.article_body: SpaceX CEO Elon Musk has said that Starlink is the only internet service left in Ukraine, and Russia is actively trying to kill it too. "Internet fibre, phone lines, cell towers...have been destroyed. Starlink is all that's left. For now," Musk tweeted. Ukraine's Vice Prime Minister Mykhailo Fedorov said Musk is among the world's top private donors supporting Ukraine.

163.title: Shouldn't country be freed from dynastic politics, asks Amit Shah
163.article_body: Addressing a rally in the poll-bound Himachal Pradesh's Sirmaur district, Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Saturday said, "Shouldn't the country be freed from dynastic politics? PM [Narendra] Modi has done the work of ending 'parivarvad' in politics." "Congress, in the desire for power, hasn't been able to respect our heritage," he added.

164.title: Brothers sentenced to 40 yrs in prison for murdering Maltese journalist
164.article_body: Two brothers were sentenced to 40 years in prison each on Friday after admitting to the murder of Maltese anti-corruption journalist Daphne Caruana Galizia. She was killed by a car bomb on October 16, 2017. Known as the "one-woman WikiLeaks", Galizia uncovered networks of corruption in Malta and abroad. She was also known as a harsh critic of the government.

165.title: Brightest-ever gamma ray burst spotted, NASA shares pic of its afterglow
165.article_body: Astronomers spotted the brightest-ever gamma ray burst (GRB) that occurred 2.4 billion light years from Earth. It was likely triggered by a supernova explosion giving birth to a black hole and the burst lasted for more than 10 hours. NASA shared a picture of the afterglow captured by Swift's X-Ray Telescope about an hour after the GRB was first detected.

166.title: Woman's sexually provocative dress isn't a license to man to outrage her modesty: HC
166.article_body: Kerala High Court's Justice Kauser Edappagath observed that objectifying a woman based on her attire cannot be justified, adding, "Even if a woman wears a sexually provocative dress, that cannot give a license to a man to outrage her modesty." The court added that there cannot be any thought that women dress only to lure male attention.

167.title: We'll take a lot of risks without worrying about result: Rohit on T20 WC
167.article_body: India captain Rohit Sharma said he and his team will look to take a "lot of risks" without worrying about the result during the T20 World Cup 2022. "Teams have become fearless...We're...looking to adopt the same approach," added Rohit. "140 used to be a winning total...[in 2007] but these days teams aim to reach there in 14-15 overs," he stated.

168.title: 21-yr-old woman accuses IAS officer, 1 other of gangrape in Andaman
168.article_body: A 21-year-old woman has accused an IAS officer, earlier posted as Chief Secretary in Andaman and Nicobar Islands, and one other bureaucrat of gangraping her in Port Blair. The victim said she was sexually assaulted on two occasions in April and May. An FIR has been registered and a Special Investigation Team has been set up to investigate the allegations.

169.title: We will not overlook any kind of military provocations: North Korea
169.article_body: North Korea on Saturday said it "will never allow any provocation by the enemies", referring to artillery fire by South Korea near the border. "[We'll take] overwhelming military countermeasures," a spokesman of the North Korean People's Army (KPA) said. On Friday, North Korea had fired a short-range ballistic missile into the sea and hundreds of artillery rounds near the border.

170.title: Nations must preserve vital foreign reserves amid rising US dollar: IMF
170.article_body: Amid a rising US dollar and depreciation of other major currencies, IMF urged countries to preserve vital foreign reserves for the future. In a blog post, IMF's First Deputy Managing Director Gita Gopinath and Chief Economist Pierre-Olivier Gourinchas said in such a fragile environment, it is prudent to enhance resilience. Notably, the dollar is at its highest level since 2000.

171.title: Yuvi & I would scare opponents: Raina on need for lefty batter in WC lineup
171.article_body: Suresh Raina termed the presence of a left-handed batter in India's lineup for T20 World Cup 2022 as "very important". "When Yuvraj Singh and I played, we'd scare the opponents...I am sure they are...thinking [about] it, but whoever they play, we've to win," added Raina. "A left-right combination can upset the rhythm, especially...[considering the big grounds] in Australia," he stated.

172.title: BJP responsible for ₹900 cr fine on Delhi by National Green Tribunal: AAP
172.article_body: BJP is responsible for ₹900 crore fine imposed on the Delhi government by the National Green Tribunal (NGT), AAP's Durgesh Pathak alleged. The people of Delhi will have to pay the price for the "inefficiency" of the BJP-run Municipal Corporation of Delhi, he said. NGT imposed ₹900 crore fine on the Delhi government over unprocessed waste at three landfills.

173.title: 3-storey building collapses in UP; 1 killed, 4 seriously injured
173.article_body: A person was killed and about four others seriously injured after a three-storey building collapsed in Uttar Pradesh's Aligarh, police said on Saturday. The locals claimed that the building, which serves as a factory's godown, was in poor shape and rain and waterlogging in the past week had made the situation worse. Rescue operations are continuing, the District Magistrate said.

174.title: Kashmiri Pandit man shot dead by terrorists in J&K
