174.article_body: A Kashmiri Pandit man identified as Puran Krishan was shot dead by terrorists in Jammu and Kashmir's Shopian district on Saturday, officials said. They added that he was attacked near his residence and doctors declared him brought dead after he was shifted to a Shopian hospital. The area has been cordoned off.

175.title: Hindutva not the antidote: Chidambaram on India's global hunger ranking
175.article_body: After India's rank on Global Hunger Index (GHI) 2022 dropped to 107th position, Congress leader P Chidambaram on Saturday tweeted, "When will [PM Narendra Modi] address real issues like malnutrition, hunger, and stunting and wasting among children?" Adding that India's score has worsened since 2014, he said, "Hindutva, imposing Hindi and spreading hate are not the antidote to hunger."

176.title: HDFC-HDFC Bank merger gets NCLT approval for shareholders' meet
176.article_body: The NCLT gave its nod for holding a shareholders' meeting for seeking approval for the proposed merger of HDFC Limited with HDFC Bank. The meeting will be convened on November 25. The deal is valued at about $40 billion. HDFC Limited also received SEBI's approval for the transfer of HDFC Property Ventures Limited, its wholly-owned subsidiary, to HDFC Bank.

177.title: Instagram introduces AI-powered age verification process in India
177.article_body: Instagram has announced that it is expanding the testing options for its AI-powered age verification feature to India and Brazil. The feature will allow users to upload a video of themselves, which Instagram runs through an AI system to determine whether the user is aged 18 or older. Meta has partnered with Yoti that specialises in AI-based online age verification.

178.title: Apple's mixed reality headset to scan eyes for payments: Report
178.article_body: Apple's rumored virtual and augmented reality headset will reportedly have the ability to scan eyes to allow users to sign into their accounts and make payments. The feature will make it easier for multiple people to use the same device, The Information reported. The headset will also have downward-facing cameras to capture the leg movement of users, the report stated.

179.title: TN vigilance dept seizes ₹1.12 cr unaccounted cash in govt office raids
179.article_body: Tamil Nadu's Vigilance and Anti-Corruption department conducted raids on 27 government offices that belonged to 16 departments. A total of ₹1.12 crore unaccounted cash was seized, out of which ₹75 lakh was seized from the guest house of the Tiruvarur Highways Department. Officials said that ₹8.87 lakh was seized from the office of the Assistant Director, Highways Namakkal.

180.title: Probe non-payment of dividends by Cairn India to Cairn UK: SC to SEBI
180.article_body: The Supreme Court asked the SEBI to hold an inquiry into the non-payment of over ₹340-crore dividends by Cairn India to Cairn UK Holdings within six months. The Securities Appellate Tribunal (SAT) had in July quashed SEBI's order rejecting Cairn UK's complaint for non-payment of dividends from Cairn India. Cairn India merged with Vedanta Limited in April 2017.

181.title: Pivotal to break shackles of colonialism by removing regressive laws: PM
181.article_body: PM Modi pitched for ease of living and ease of justice during the inaugural session of the All India Conference of Law Ministers and Law Secretaries. "Delay in justice is one of the challenges. It's important for us to break the shackles of colonialism by removing regressive colonial laws, then only India can progress in true sense," said the PM.

182.title: Amul hikes milk prices by ₹2 per litre in all states except Gujarat
182.article_body: Amul on Saturday announced that it is increasing the prices of full cream milk and buffalo milk by ₹2 per litre. The new price will be applicable in all states except Gujarat, RS Sodhi, the MD of Gujarat Cooperative Milk Marketing Federation, said. With the hike, Amul's full cream milk will now cost ₹63 per litre, up from ₹61 earlier.

183.title: Centre, 6 states get NHRC notice over Devadasi system in temples
183.article_body: The National Human Rights Commission (NHRC) has sought reports from the Centre and six states on actions taken against the "continued menace of Devadasi system in various temples". The six states include Karnataka, Kerala, Tamil Nadu, Andhra Pradesh, Telangana and Maharashtra. "Victims of this malpractice are…sexually exploited by men, impregnated and left on their fate," noted the NHRC.

184.title: 11-year-old boy sexually assaulted by cleric at madrasa in Delhi
184.article_body: A cleric was arrested for allegedly sexually assaulting an 11-year-old boy at a madrasa in Delhi. According to the boy's mother, he had been going to the madrasa to study for four years but stopped last month, DCP (Northeast) said. The accused had also threatened the boy, police said. The boy reportedly told his mother about the ordeal on Thursday.

185.title: UK PM Liz Truss appoints Jeremy Hunt as new Finance Minister
185.article_body: UK Prime Minister Liz Truss on Friday appointed Jeremy Hunt, who has previously served as Health Secretary and Foreign Secretary, as the country's new Finance Minister. His predecessor Kwasi Kwarteng was sacked by Truss after less than six weeks on the job. Notably, Hunt backed Truss's rival former chancellor Rishi Sunak in the Tory leadership race early this year.

186.title: SC suspends Bombay HC order acquitting ex-DU professor GN Saibaba in Maoist links case
186.article_body: The Supreme Court has suspended the impugned judgment and order of the Bombay High Court acquitting former Delhi University Professor GN Saibaba and others in a case relating to their alleged Maoist links. "High Court has not considered the merits. The HC discharged the accused only on the ground that the sanction was invalid," the top court noted.

187.title: India unlikely to be hit as hard by global recession as other nations: SBI Chief
187.article_body: The impact of global recession is unlikely to hit India as hard as compared to other countries, SBI Chairman Dinesh Khara said. With a projected growth rate of 6.8% and inflation "much under control", India is doing reasonably well, he said. "Indian economy's beta factor would be much lower" than economies that have a significant component of export, he added.

188.title: Meta to shut Instant Articles on Facebook by April 2023: Report
188.article_body: Meta will shut its Instant Articles format on Facebook by April 2023 as the company aims to focus on TikTok-like offerings, Axios reported. With this step, news publishers will get six months to re-adjust their Facebook strategies. Earlier this month, Meta announced that it will shut its newsletter product called Bulletin for creators and writers by early 2023.

189.title: Nikhil Chinapa shares video of cockroach on Vistara flight, says 'sanitise your plane'
189.article_body: DJ Nikhil Chinapa has asked Vistara airline to stop sending him "unsolicited messages" and shared a screenshot of a Vistara message providing him sanitised cabs to travel in Mumbai. He then shared a video of a cockroach in a Vistara flight and tweeted, "It's funny you mention providing sanitised cabs. Perhaps start with sanitising your planes first."

190.title: Screams fishy: Jet Airways CEO on viral pic of cockroach in Vistara flight meal
190.article_body: After a passenger tweeted pictures claiming that he found a cockroach in the meal served on Air Vistara flight, Jet Airways CEO Sanjiv Kapoor said it "screams fishy". Noting that the passenger posted the photos two months after his flight, Kapoor called it a "hit-job". Vistara's probe found that the brown particle in meal was "a sautéd piece of ginger".

191.title: Whenever we meet, we just ask 'How are things at home?': Rohit on chat with Pak's Babar
191.article_body: Talking about his interaction with Pakistan captain Babar Azam whenever they meet, India captain Rohit Sharma said, "We just ask, 'How are things at home?' 'How's the family?' We just talk about that." He added, "Our last generation also said that we talk about our families, life, which new car you've bought, which new car you are about to buy."

192.title: NASA's SpaceX Crew-4 astronauts return to Earth after 170 days
192.article_body: NASA's SpaceX Crew-4 mission astronauts have safely returned to Earth from International Space Station. A SpaceX capsule, carrying three NASA astronauts and one European Space Agency's astronaut, splashed down in the Atlantic Ocean off the coast of Florida on Friday. The astronauts returned after spending 170 days in orbit, NASA said. The mission was launched on April 27.

193.title: 32,000 compliances removed in 8 years to improve ease of living: PM
193.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Saturday said that his government removed about 32,000 compliances in the last eight years to improve ease of living. "It is important for us to break the shackles of colonialism by removing regressing colonial laws," he said, addressing the inaugural session of the All India Conference of Law Ministers and Secretaries.

194.title: UP CM Yogi's convoy gives way to ambulance with critical patient
194.article_body: Under Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath's orders, an ambulance which was caught in a traffic jam in Varanasi due to VIP protocol, as the CM's convoy was on the way, was allowed to pass on priority. The ambulance had a critical female patient on board who "needed immediate medical attention", the district's Police Commissioner said. The incident occurred on Friday.

195.title: Centre pulling money out of common man's pockets: Bhupesh Baghel
195.article_body: Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel criticised the Centre over inflation and alleged that the government is pulling money out of common man's pockets. "They have increased the prices of petrol and diesel. Now they've imposed GST as well, 5% on 'rotis' and 18% on 'parathas'…Make Congress win in Himachal Pradesh by a 3/4th majority," said Baghel.

196.title: Former Pak chief justice shot dead in targeted firing outside mosque
196.article_body: A former High Court Chief Justice of Pakistan's Balochistan province was shot dead as he came out of a mosque after offering prayers on Friday evening, police officials said. Muhammad Noor Meskanzai died while he was being taken to a hospital in Quetta. Police have launched an investigation to find the motive behind the targeted attack.

197.title: 14-yr-old girl forced to remove clothes by teacher, sets herself on fire in Jharkhand
197.article_body: A 14-year-old Class 9 student studying at a girls' school in Jharkhand's Jamshedpur set herself on fire on Friday allegedly after she was forcibly made to remove clothes by a teacher. She is reportedly in critical condition. She told police that the woman invigilator made her remove clothes to find out if she was hiding paper chits in her uniform.

198.title: What is the format of T20 World Cup 2022?
198.article_body: T20 World Cup 2022 will commence with Round 1 tomorrow. Round 1 will be played between Sri Lanka, West Indies and six teams from 2022 Qualifiers in a two-group round-robin format. Top two teams from each group will join eight automatic qualifiers in Super 12 stage, which'll see two groups of six teams competing in a round-robin format.

199.title: Hours after loan default notice, Kerala man wins ₹70 lakh lottery
199.article_body: On October 12, Pookunju, a fish seller from Kerala's Kollam, received a bank notice of attachment for his house for failing to repay a loan of ₹9 lakh. His wife said they didn't know what to do and were wondering whether to sell their house. However, Pookunju had bought a lottery ticket earlier that day. It won him ₹70 lakh.

200.title: Court grants bail to main accused in Jahangirpuri violence case
200.article_body: A Delhi court granted bail to Tabrez, the main accused in the April Jahangirpuri violence case. "It'll take a long time to conclude the trial...no purpose would be served to keep the accused in judicial custody," the court said. Tabrez and his associate had allegedly recruited others to "take revenge for deaths of their community people during the 2020 riots".

201.title: ISRO's heaviest rocket to launch UK startup OneWeb's 36 satellites
201.article_body: The Indian Space Research Organisation's (ISRO) heaviest rocket, LVM3, will launch 36 broadband satellites of the British startup OneWeb in LVM3 – M2/OneWeb India-1 Mission on October 23. The mission, which will be launched from spaceport in Andhra Pradesh's Sriharikota, will make LVM3 enter the global commercial launch service market. India's Bharti Enterprises is a major investor in OneWeb.

202.title: India drops to 107th rank in Global Hunger Index 2022, behind Pakistan & Bangladesh
202.article_body: India has slipped six places on Global Hunger Index 2022 to take 107th position out of 121 countries ranked. With a score of 29.1, the index's publishers Concern Worldwide and Welthungerhilfe have labelled the level of hunger in India as "serious". Meanwhile, Pakistan (99), Sri Lanka (64), Bangladesh (84), Nepal (81) and Myanmar (71) have been ranked above India.

203.title: I already have my XI for Pakistan match: Rohit Sharma on T20 World Cup 2022 clash
203.article_body: During the pre-T20 World Cup 2022 press conference, Team India captain Rohit Sharma said that he already has his XI for the match against Pakistan, which will take place on October 23. "I don't believe in last-minute decisions," Rohit said, adding that the players have also been informed about the playing XI.

204.title: Pics of Rohit Sharma, Babar Azam from T20 World Cup 2022 photoshoot go viral
204.article_body: Pictures of Team India captain Rohit Sharma and Pakistan captain Babar Azam posing together in a photoshoot ahead of T20 World Cup 2022 have gone viral. India will face Pakistan in their first match of the 16-team tournament on October 23. The match will take place at Melbourne Cricket Ground (MCG).

205.title: 21-yr-old wanting escort job loses ₹76,500 to fraudster in Mumbai
205.article_body: A 21-year-old man who wanted to work as a male escort was conned by a fraudster into losing ₹76,500 on the pretext of paying various taxes and charges to join the services in Mumbai. According to police, the complainant works for a car wash company in Chembur. Due to less income, he began looking for alternate options to earn money.

206.title: Indian man serves free food in Ukraine, says 'Made good money here, now we're spending'
206.article_body: An Indian man is serving free meals to hundreds of people daily in Ukraine amid war. "We have made good money here, in Ukraine, so we are now spending it on people," Kuldeep Kumar, who runs New Bombay Palace restaurant in Kyiv, said. "My family is here. They're all Ukrainians. These are tough times...so we are helping people," he added.

207.title: Pakistan is one of the most dangerous nations in the world: US President
207.article_body: During a press briefing, US President Joe Biden called Pakistan "one of the most dangerous nations in the world". While talking about Chinese President Xi Jinping, he stated, "This is a guy who understands what he wants but has...enormous array of problems. How do we handle that? How do we handle that relative to what's going on in Russia...[and] Pakistan?"

208.title: Eight flights diverted from Mumbai airport due to heavy rainfall
208.article_body: Eight flights were diverted from Mumbai to nearby airports on Friday due to heavy rainfall and low visibility conditions. Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj International Airport (CSMIA) notified all passengers of flight delays and provided refreshments to those waiting to board. Several parts of Mumbai, especially the eastern suburbs, received heavy rains on Friday evening.

209.title: Woman gets stuck in traffic, gives birth inside car in Gurugram
209.article_body: A woman gave birth to her baby boy inside a car after getting stuck in traffic while on the way to a hospital in Gurugram. The woman's mother-in-law said that they were stuck in traffic for about 30 minutes. The woman, who later reportedly reached the hospital in 45 minutes, and her baby boy are in healthy condition.

210.title: Fake currency notes with ₹2 lakh face value seized in Pune; 3 held
210.article_body: Directorate of Revenue Intelligence officers have seized fake Indian currency notes of ₹500 denomination with a face value of ₹2 lakh in Pune and arrested three people. The arrests were made after officers caught one of the accused, who was riding a motorcycle, with fake currency. An investigation has revealed that the fake currency was smuggled into India from Bangladesh.

211.title: Wipro senior exec Angan Guha quits, 5th senior-level exit in 2 months: Report
211.article_body: Angan Guha, a senior Wipro executive who was overseeing a third of the company's overall business, has moved out of the firm, Mint reported. Guha is the fifth senior-level executive to leave the Bengaluru-headquartered firm in the past two months. Guha was directly responsible for the largest share of Wipro's business, Americas 2 Strategic Market Unit.

212.title: ICC shares pic of all 16 captains ahead of T20 World Cup
212.article_body: The International Cricket Council (ICC) on Saturday shared a picture of all 16 captains of the teams participating in the T20 World Cup, starting on October 16. "All the 16 captains in one frame," the ICC tweeted with picture. The world cricket's governing body also shared a selfie taken by the 16 players.

213.title: 'Make-in-India' record-breaker: Piyush Goyal as phone exports hit $1 bn in Sept
213.article_body: Union Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal lauded the government's production-linked incentive (PLI) scheme after a report claimed that India exported mobile phones worth $1 billion in September, setting a new record. "'Make-in-India' record-breaker," tweeted Goyal. Notably, the previous monthly record for mobile phone exports from India stood at $770 million in December 2021, as per the Economic Times.

214.title: India left with ordinary medium pacers: Aaqib Javed on Bumrah's injury
214.article_body: Former Pakistan pacer Aaqib Javed said Team India's bowling for the T20 World Cup 2022 only comprises "ordinary medium pacers" after Jasprit Bumrah was ruled out. "Bumrah's absence is a big blow...You need someone who has an intimidating presence...India's form hasn't been great," added Javed. Javed had earlier stated that Team India should name Umran Malik as Bumrah's replacement.

215.title: Chhattisgarh announces 5% Dearness Allowance hike for govt employees
215.article_body: CM Bhupesh Baghel-led Chhattisgarh government announced a hike of 5% in the Dearness Allowance (DA) of the state government employees. The hike will be effective from October 1, 2022, and around 3.80 lakh state employees will benefit from it. With this hike in DA, those who receive salary under the 7th Pay Commission will now get 33%, an official said.

216.title: Man bites police dog while resisting arrest in Germany
216.article_body: German police on Friday said they have arrested a 29-year-old man for resisting arrest and biting a service dog. The incident happened after officers were called to a dispute between two 29-year-old men and a 35-year-old woman in Ginsheim-Gustavsburg town shortly after midnight. A police officer was injured during the incident after being punched by the woman in the face.

217.title: Traffic diversions at many places for Delhi Half Marathon on Sunday
217.article_body: Traffic restrictions will be placed at many locations in Delhi as the national capital is set to witness, after a gap of two years, a half marathon this Sunday. About 25,000 people are expected to participate in the Delhi Half Marathon. Traffic will be diverted at Aurobindo Marg-Lodhi Road Junction, Mathura Road-Bhairon Marg Junction and other places.

218.title: Turkish coal mine blast kills 25, leaves dozens trapped
218.article_body: At least 25 people have died and dozens remain trapped underground after an explosion in a coal mine in northern Turkey. A total of 110 workers were at the mine at the time of the explosion. Energy Minister Fatih Donmez said the initial indications were that the blast was caused by firedamp, a term referring to methane in coal mines.

219.title: 200 naked decomposing bodies found on rooftop of hospital in Pakistan
219.article_body: Over 200 decomposing bodies of people were found on a rooftop of a hospital in Pakistan's Punjab province, following which its CM ordered a committee to investigate the matter. Adviser to the Chief Minister Chaudhry Zaman Gujjar said, "All of the decomposing bodies were naked. Women's bodies were also not covered." The authorities ordered cremation of the bodies.

220.title: Suspect in US shooting that killed 5 identified as a 15-year-old boy
220.article_body: Police in North Carolina have said that the suspect involved in a shootout that killed five people on Thursday was a 15-year-old boy. The suspect, who is currently admitted in a hospital in critical condition, was taken into custody three hours after the shooting began in Raleigh's Hedingham neighbourhood. The motive behind the shooting is yet to be determined.

221.title: Will never ally with BJP again, will work for 'samajwadis': Bihar CM
221.article_body: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar has declared that he will never ally with the BJP again and said that he will stay with the 'samajwadis' and take the country forward. "The BJP is working to create conflict in the society…Those sitting at the Centre have nothing to do with the development…BJP people keep talking nonsense," said Kumar.

222.title: Electric car goes from zero to 100 kmph in 1.461 seconds in Germany, sets world record
222.article_body: An electric car in Germany has set the Guinness World Record for the fastest electric vehicle acceleration. The carbon racing car accelerated from zero to 100 kmph in 1.461 seconds, breaking the previous world record of 1.513 seconds. A 2021 formula student car designed by the University of Stuttgart's GreenTeam was used for the attempt to set the world record.

223.title: 100 students fall ill due to suspected gas leak at school in Tamil Nadu
223.article_body: Nearly 100 students suddenly fell sick allegedly due to a suspected gas leak from a septic tank on the premises of a school in Tamil Nadu's Hosur, an official said on Friday. A total of 67 students were hospitalised following the incident. Krishnagiri District Collector V Jaya Chandra Bhanu Reddy visited the school and hospital where students were being treated.

224.title: India reports 2,430 new COVID-19 cases, active cases stand at 26,618
224.article_body: India reported 2,430 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country recorded 2,678 new COVID-19 cases. The active cases in India now stand at 26,618. The COVID-19 death toll so far has reached 5,28,874 following 17 casualties in the last 24 hours.

225.title: Body of missing senior Maharashtra official found in Nira river
225.article_body: The body of Joint Director of Maharashtra Directorate of Marketing Shashikant Ghorpade, who went missing two days ago, was found in the Nira river on Friday, according to police. The police said that Ghorpade's car was found in front of a hotel near the bridge on the river. Ghorpade's family had filed a missing case in Satara.

226.title: US woman told to move dog on plane abuses cabin crew, hits man with bottle; video viral
226.article_body: A video of a woman abusing cabin crew of an Atlanta to New York flight after she was told to move her dog from her lap is going viral on social media. The video shows the woman throwing a bottle of water at a male passenger who told her to get off the flight. She was removed from the aircraft.

227.title: India will be thinking about T20 WC 2021 loss vs Pak: Suresh Raina
227.article_body: Suresh Raina said India will be thinking about their loss against Pakistan in the T20 World Cup 2021, while planning for their upcoming T20 World Cup 2022 match against the latter. "This game won't be easy for India," added Raina. "We need to set the tone [from] the first game, win against Pakistan and the...World Cup will follow," he stated.

228.title: 79% commuters support free bus travel in Bengaluru: Report
228.article_body: About 79% of bus commuters in Bengaluru support free travel, a report by Greenpeace India showed. Based on a survey of 558 people, the report titled 'Bustling Through Bengaluru' said that the majority of respondents were in favour of free bus travel, especially for women and students. About 45% of respondents want more buses to be added to the fleet.

229.title: Bajaj Auto Q2 profit rises 20% y-o-y to ₹1,530 cr, revenue up 16%
229.article_body: Bajaj Auto Limited reported a 20% increase in its standalone net profit for the quarter ended September at ₹1,530 crore as against ₹1,274.55 crore in the corresponding quarter last year. Its revenue from operations rose by 16% to ₹10,202.77 crore from ₹8,762.18 crore in the September quarter of FY22. The company's total sales increased by 0.6% to 11.51 lakh units.

230.title: Massive fire breaks out at auto parts manufacturing company in Gurugram
230.article_body: A massive fire broke out at an auto parts manufacturing company in Bilaspur Industrial area in Haryana's Gurugram on Saturday morning, officials said. No loss of life has been reported so far and the fire tenders are at the site. After hours of operations, the fire is yet to be doused completely, as per reports.

231.title: New ransomware 'Prestige' targeted Ukraine, Poland entities: Microsoft
231.article_body: Microsoft on Friday said it has detected new ransomware named 'Prestige' that targeted transportation and logistics companies in Ukraine and Poland. The ransomware was deployed on October 11 in attacks occurring within an hour of each other across all victims, Microsoft said. 'Prestige' encrypts a victim's data and asks them to purchase a decryption tool to unlock data, it added.

232.title: Murdoch considers merging Fox, News Corp nearly 10 yrs after split
232.article_body: Billionaire media mogul Rupert Murdoch is considering merging his News Corp and Fox Corporation, nearly a decade after the companies split. Both firms on Friday said they have formed special committees to review proposals for a potential combination. News Corp and Fox had market capitalisation of reportedly $9.31 billion and $16.84 billion, respectively, as of US market-close on Friday.

233.title: Saudi Arabia announces $400 million humanitarian aid to Ukraine
233.article_body: Saudi Arabia will provide $400 million in humanitarian aid to Ukraine amid the ongoing war, Saudi state news agency SPA said. Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman also spoke to Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy on Friday. During the call, the Crown Prince expressed the Kingdom's readiness to continue efforts of mediation and support everything that contributes to de-escalation, SPA added.

234.title: Actress shares pic of her bruised face after being held by Iranian forces
234.article_body: Iranian actress Pantea Bahram has shared a picture of her bruised face after she was held by Iranian security forces for several days. The 52-year-old actress can be seen with a scar near her eye and one above her lips. This comes amid protests in Iran over 22-year-old Mahsa Amini's death after being detained by the country's morality police.

235.title: Shree Cement elevates MD Hari Mohan Bangur to Chairman's post
235.article_body: Shree Cement's board approved the elevation of Managing Director Hari Mohan Bangur to the Chairman's post with effect from October 15. Neeraj Akhoury, the former MD & CEO of ACC and Ambuja Cements, will be appointed as its Managing Director for five years. Chairman Benu Gopal Bangur has resigned and has been appointed as Chairman Emeritus of the company.

236.title: Shree Cement Q2 profit falls 67% y-o-y to ₹189 cr, revenue up 18%
236.article_body: Shree Cement reported a 67% decline in standalone net profit at ₹189 crore in the September quarter as against a profit of ₹578 crore in the corresponding period of FY22. The profit dropped 40% from ₹316 crore during the previous quarter on a sequential basis. The firm's standalone revenues increased by 18% to ₹3,781 crore year-on-year as against ₹3,206 crore.

237.title: Frozen or packed paratha different from roti, to attract 18% GST: Gujarat AAAR
237.article_body: Gujarat's Appellate Authority for Advance Ruling (AAAR) has ruled that frozen or packed parathas will attract a GST of 18% as opposed to plain chapati or roti, which attract 5% GST. The appellate authority noted that frozen or packed parathas are different from rotis and require three to four minutes of cooking till it turns golden brown on both sides.

238.title: Traffic diversions announced in Hyd for Venkateshwara Vaibhavotsavam
238.article_body: On the final day of the celebration of Sri Venkateshwara Vaibhavotsavam on Saturday, traffic diversions will remain in place between 3 pm to 10 pm near Hyderabad's NTR Stadium. "Traffic coming from Ashok Nagar will not be allowed towards NTR Stadium and will be diverted at Bakaram Bridge towards CGO Towers and Bansilalpet," said Hyderabad Traffic Police in an advisory.

239.title: Heavy rainfall causes waterlogging, traffic congestion in Pune
239.article_body: Some parts of Pune faced traffic congestion after roads got waterlogged due to heavy rainfall on Friday. Five tree-felling incidents were also reported from Kondhwa Budruk, Dhanori, Erandwane, Ganj Peth and Hadapsar areas in the city. India Meteorological Department (IMD) Pune official Anupam Kashyapi said, "Light rainfall is likely to continue in Pune for the next few days."

240.title: Woman kept in dog cage for 20 days after being kidnapped in Philippines, escapes
240.article_body: A Chinese woman escaped after allegedly being kidnapped during a night out and locked in a dog cage for 20 days in the Philippines. Following her disappearance, her boyfriend claimed to have received a ransom demand for $200,000 for her freedom. He was also sent a video that allegedly showed his girlfriend being beaten up by a baseball bat.

241.title: 3 arrested for smuggling mephedrone in Pune, 20.26 grams recovered
241.article_body: Pune City Police arrested three persons for allegedly smuggling and selling the banned drug mephedrone (MD). Police arrested two accused from the Lulla Nagar area after recovering 20.26 grams of MD worth ₹3 lakh from their possession. The third accused, who had allegedly provided the MD to the other two, was arrested later from Kondhwa.

242.title: 6 arrested for stabbing habitual offender to death in Hyderabad
242.article_body: Six people have been arrested for allegedly killing habitual offender Syed Bakhtiyar Agha Qureshi alias Agha shooter in Hyderabad. "On October 4, when Agha shooter reached behind Anmol hotel, the six arrested persons pounced on him and stabbed him to death with knives and daggers all of them were carrying," said DCP P Sai Chaitanya.

243.title: Over 40 rescued from Goa's Dudhsagar Falls after cable bridge collapses due to rain
243.article_body: Over 40 tourists were rescued from Goa's Dudhsagar Falls after a cable bridge collapsed due to heavy rain, as per an official statement. The incident took place on Friday evening when the water level at the waterfall rose amid heavy rain. "The River Lifesaver rescued around 40 guests...I thank and congratulate (them) for rescuing the tourists," CM Pramod Sawant tweeted.

244.title: Russia can destroy US, Europe within 30 minutes with nuclear missiles: Musk
244.article_body: The world's richest person Elon Musk on Saturday tweeted, "Russia has the ability to destroy USA and Europe utterly with nuclear missiles in less than 30 minutes and vice versa." He added that it would be "MAD" to use the nuclear weapons. Musk earlier said, "If we were dealing with reasonable people, we wouldn't have war in the first place."

245.title: Don't push nuclear-armed Russia into a corner, warns Belarus Prez
245.article_body: Belarusian President Alexander Lukashenko warned Ukraine and the West against forcing his ally Russia "into a corner", saying Moscow has nuclear weapons for a reason. "Russia has clearly outlined its position: God forbid there will be an attack on the territory of the Russian Federation; in that event, Russia can use all types of weapons if necessary," Lukashenko added.

246.title: House owner shoots suspected robber dead in Ghaziabad; case filed
246.article_body: A house owner shot dead a suspected robber after he along with others allegedly tried to enter the house and opened fire in Ghaziabad's Sahibabad on Friday, police said. The SSP said that incident occurred after the house owner "retaliated by firing from his licenced pistol". An FIR under IPC's Section 398 and 459 has been filed, an SHO said.

247.title: Bengaluru on yellow alert today, light to moderate rain till Oct 19
247.article_body: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has issued a yellow alert for Bengaluru for Saturday, predicting 64.5 to 115.5 mm of rainfall. It added that the city is expected to witness light to moderate rain till October 19. Parts of the city, including Indiranagar, Mahadevapura and HSR Layout, saw waterlogging after 66 mm of rainfall on Friday.

248.title: 5-foot-long checkered keelback snake spotted at Amit Shah's house
248.article_body: A five-foot-long checkered keelback, commonly known as Asiatic water snake, was spotted at Union Home Minister Amit Shah's residence on Thursday. "Geared with rescue equipment, a two-member rescue team rushed to the snake's aid...We are grateful to the security personnel working in the Union Home Minister's residence for alerting Wildlife SOS to this emergency," Wildlife SOS said.

249.title: Tata Power hit by cyberattack, says 'all critical operational systems functioning'
249.article_body: Tata Power has confirmed that it was hit by a cyberattack that impacted some of its IT systems. "[We have] taken steps to retrieve and restore the systems. All critical operational systems are functioning," the power generation company wrote in a statement to stock exchanges. Tata Power has restricted access for employee and customer facing portals as a precautionary measure.

250.title: Rickshaw driver killed, 2 others injured in multi-vehicle crash in Delhi
250.article_body: A 40-year-old rickshaw driver died and two others were injured after an RTV (Rural Transport Vehicle) bus, a rickshaw, an auto-rickshaw and a motorcycle crashed near Kalkaji Depot in Delhi's Okhla, police said. The RTV driver lost balance and hit other vehicles, police added. The 26-year-old driver was apprehended on the spot, police further said.

251.title: He was one of the funniest people I've met: Daniel Radcliffe on Robbie Coltrane's demise
251.article_body: Daniel Radcliffe, who portrayed the titular role in the 'Harry Potter' films, mourned the demise of Robbie Coltrane, who portrayed Hagrid. "Robbie was one of the funniest people I've met and used to keep us laughing constantly as kids on the set," Radcliffe said. "He was an incredible actor and a lovely man," he added.

252.title: Bangladesh make 2 last-minute changes to their T20 World Cup 2022 squad
252.article_body: Bangladesh have made two last-minute changes to their T20 World Cup 2022 squad after the tri-series in New Zealand. Soumya Sarkar and Shoriful Islam have been included in the final 15-member group. The duo replace Sabbir Rahman and Mohammad Saifuddin in the squad. Both Shoriful and Sarkar were initially named in the reserves for the tournament.

253.title: India briefs G-20 countries on its agenda ahead of presidency
253.article_body: India has briefed the member nations of the G20 on the agenda that New Delhi will be pursuing when it assumes the grouping's rotating presidency next year. Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman and Reserve Bank of India Governor Shaktikanta Das elaborated on India's agenda during a G20 leaders meeting in Washington on Thursday. Details of the agenda were not disclosed.

254.title: Russian man detained in Norway admits to illegally flying drones
254.article_body: A 50-year-old Russian man, who was detained in Arctic Norway earlier in the week, has admitted to illegally flying two drones in Norwegian airspace over areas potentially with critical energy infrastructure. The man was produced in a Norwegian court on Friday and was sent to two weeks in custody. Three passports (two Russian and one Israeli) were recovered from him.

255.title: Should create a gas exchange market in Turkey: Putin to Erdogan
255.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin has proposed that a natural gas exchange market be set up in Turkey. "We could consider building another gas pipeline...in Turkey for sale to third countries, especially in Europe," he said, adding that the hub "will be an international distribution centre". He made the comments during a meeting with his Turkish counterpart Recep Erdogan.

256.title: Pakistan make 1 change to their T20 World Cup 2022 squad, replace Qadir with Fakhar
256.article_body: Pakistan have made a change to their T20 World Cup 2022 squad, with standby batter Fakhar Zaman being promoted to the 15-player main squad. He has replaced leg-spinner Usman Qadir. Qadir hasn't played for Pakistan since he hurt his thumb while fielding during the fourth T20I against England last month and he is yet to recover.

257.title: Files of 27 yrs of corruption burnt in Guj: Cong on Old Secretariat fire
257.article_body: The Congress has alleged that the fire that broke out at Gujarat's Old Secretariat on Friday was an attempt by the BJP to burn government files to hide corruption ahead of the state Assembly elections. "The BJP is aware of going out of power...In this panic, the files of 27 years of corruption are being burnt," the party added.

258.title: TMC's Sudip Bandyopadhyay compromised with BJP: TMC MLA
258.article_body: TMC MLA Tapas Roy on Friday accused TMC MP Sudip Bandyopadhyay of "compromising" with "opposition BJP". Calling Bandyopadhyay a "white elephant", the senior TMC leader added, "What has been his role in the Parliament, apart from praising Prime Minister Narendra Modi's dress?" Notably, Roy has been criticising Bandyopadhyay for the past few days for allegedly promoting BJP leader Tamoghna Ghosh.

259.title: Thank you all: World no. 2 Nadal on wishes after the birth of his child
259.article_body: World number two Rafael Nadal took to Twitter on Thursday after the birth of his baby boy last week and wrote, "Hello everyone. After a few days and many loving messages I just wanted to thank you all!" "We are very happy and everyone is very well! A big hug," he added. Nadal last played in Laver Cup in September.

260.title: He hasn't played 1 T20I since last WC: Aakash on Shami's inclusion in India's squad
260.article_body: Sharing his views on Mohammad Shami replacing Jasprit Bumrah in India's T20I World Cup 2022 squad, Aakash Chopra said, "Shami to replace Bumrah. Makes perfect sense." He added, "What doesn't make sense is the fact that he hasn't played a single T20I since the last World Cup. And that's got nothing to do with his fitness. He was always available."

261.title: I would go with Arshdeep, Shami, Bhuvi in playing XI for T20 WC: Uthappa
261.article_body: Ex-cricketer Robin Uthappa said that he would want India to play with three pure pacers namely Arshdeep Singh, Mohammad Shami and Bhuvneshwar Kumar in the playing XI for the T20 World Cup games. "I would ideally want to go with a left-arm fast bowler because that change of angle makes a huge difference...[and] also you have Hardik Pandya," Uthappa said.

262.title: Reece James, 2018 winner Kante doubtful for 2022 WC due to injury
262.article_body: Chelsea manager Graham Potter said England defender Reece James and French midfielder N'Golo Kante will see specialists for their injuries in the coming days. James and Kante's diagnoses will determine their chances of playing in the Qatar World Cup.  Potter also confirmed that France defender Wesley Fofana is unlikely to play in the World Cup due to a knee injury.

263.title: Urvashi Rautela accused of copying her TEDx Talks speech, social media users react
263.article_body: Urvashi Rautela made an appearance at a recent TEDx Talks event and people have claimed that she copied her speech from previous speakers. She also appears to have googled listicles about the most popular ones, and lifted points from there, people claimed. "Can we...cancel her already!" a person reacted while another comment read, "I need this kind of confidence."

264.title: After 0-8 defeat against USA, India lose 0-3 to Morocco in FIFA U-17 Women's World Cup
264.article_body: After losing their first match 0-8 against USA, India suffered a 0-3 defeat against Morocco in the FIFA Under-17 Women's World Cup in Bhubaneswar. All three of Morocco's goals came in the second half. India will not be able to advance to the knockout stage. Their last group match against Brazil will take place on October 17.

265.title: People's unity is crucial for building India: NC's Farooq Abdullah
265.article_body: National Conference (NC) President Farooq Abdullah said people's unity is crucial for building India and asked them to stand up against the "divisive forces" trying to weaken the country. "Our country is diverse, there's diversity of faiths, cultures and climates. What unites us is our faith," Abdullah said. "From Kashmir to Kanniyakumari, we have to unite this country," he added.

266.title: Robbie Coltrane, who played Hagrid in 'Harry Potter' films, passes away aged 72
266.article_body: Actor Robbie Coltrane, who played Rubeus Hagrid in 'Harry Potter' films, has passed away aged 72. He was also known for starring in British TV series 'Cracker', for which he won three consecutive Best Actor BAFTA TV awards. In a statement, his agent Belinda Wright described Coltrane as a "unique talent". He also featured in two 'James Bond' films.

267.title: Indian American student's roommate charged with murder for stabbing him to death
267.article_body: Korean student Ji Min Sha, accused of stabbing his Indian-origin roommate to death in their dormitory at US' Purdue University, has been charged with murder. Prosecutors said that Sha "knowingly or intentionally" killed 20-year-old Varun Manish Chheda. Sha (22) stabbed Chheda multiple times in the head and neck before calling the authorities to report the death.

268.title: Rudrankksh Patil wins 10m Air Rifle gold at ISSF World Championship
268.article_body: Rudrankksh Patil won gold in the men's 10m air rifle event in the ISSF World Championship in Cairo, becoming the second Indian to achieve the feat after Abhinav Bindra. The 18-year-old also secured India's second 2024 Paris Olympics quota in the process. Rudrankksh beat Italy's Danilo Dennis Sollazzo 17-13 in the gold medal match after a come-from-behind effort.

269.title: Guj poll dates not announced to give PM time to make inaugurations: Cong
269.article_body: The Congress on Friday said the Election Commission deferred announcing the election dates for Gujarat to give PM Narendra Modi more time to make "mega promises and inaugurations". "Not at all surprising," Congress leader Jairam Ramesh tweeted. His comment comes as the EC did not announce the schedule for Gujarat Assembly elections along with the dates for Himachal Pradesh elections.

270.title: Was heartbroken after being rejected for 'Bajirao...': '83' actor Addinath
270.article_body: Actor Addinath Kothare, who made his Bollywood debut in '83', revealed that he auditioned for Sanjay Leela Bhansali's 'Bajirao Mastani' but the role went to his actor-friend Vaibhav Tatwawadi instead, who essayed Chimaji Appa in the film. "I was heartbroken. It was indeed a bummer. It's the only film from my entire career that...I wish I had got," Addinath added.

271.title: John is a gentleman, was a pleasure to work with him: Manushi on 'Tehran'
271.article_body: Actress Manushi Chhillar, speaking about her upcoming film 'Tehran', said that she was happy that she had a co-actor like John Abraham. "He's a thorough professional and a gentleman and it was a pleasure to work and learn from him," she added. Manushi further said shooting for 'Tehran' was an enriching experience, adding that she learnt something new every day.

272.title: Harjot Singh Bains appointed as AAP in-charge in poll-bound Himachal
272.article_body: The Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) on Friday appointed Punjab School Education Minister Harjot Singh Bains as the party in-charge in poll-bound Himachal Pradesh. This comes after the Election Commission of India announced that the state Assembly elections will be held on November 12. The Twitter handle of AAP wrote, "Himachal will vote for change! Himachal will vote for Kejriwal!"

273.title: No need for more massive strikes on Ukraine, most designated targets hit: Putin
273.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin on Friday said there was "no need for massive strikes" on Ukraine anymore as most designated targets had been hit, after a barrage of missile strikes earlier this week killed at least 19. "We do not set ourselves the task of destroying Ukraine. No, of course not," said Putin during a news conference.

274.title: Wanted to bat like Sachin, realised I can't play like him: MS Dhoni
274.article_body: Former India captain MS Dhoni, at a recent event, said that his cricketing role model has always been Sachin Tendulkar. "I used to watch Sachin play and wanted to bat like him. Later on, I realised I can’t play like him but inside my heart, I always wanted to play like him," he said.

275.title: 4 killed as BMW car gets completely destroyed after collision with truck in UP; pics surface
275.article_body: As many as four persons were killed on Purvanchal Expressway in Uttar Pradesh's Sultanpur when a container truck hit their BMW car today. The collision was so severe that the engine of the car and all four occupants were blown away and fell at some distance away, an official said. The container truck was reportedly coming from the opposite direction.

276.title: Anil Deshmukh admitted to Mumbai hospital for angiography
276.article_body: Former Maharashtra Home Minister Anil Deshmukh, who is lodged in Arthur Road jail in Mumbai, was admitted to Jaslok Hospital on Friday to undergo coronary angiography. The Nationalist Congress Party leader was admitted to the same hospital earlier this year after he dislocated his shoulder. Deshmukh was arrested by the Enforcement Directorate in November 2021 on money laundering charges.

277.title: Liverpool, not Arsenal, biggest PL title challengers: Man City coach
277.article_body: Manchester City manager Pep Guardiola said Liverpool are the defending champions' "biggest challengers" for the Premier League title. Liverpool currently sit 10th in the table, 13 points behind City who are trailing table toppers Arsenal by one point. "I know the quality they have...with so long (in the season) left plus a World Cup, anything can happen," said Guardiola.

278.title: Haaland is a perfect fit at Manchester City: Liverpool manager Klopp
278.article_body: Praising Erling Haaland, Liverpool manager Jürgen Klopp said the Manchester City striker's "finishing skills are exceptional but he moves really smart". He added, "So many things to make a striker, and at City he has some of the best players around him setting up goals. It's a perfect fit." Liverpool will face Manchester City in Premier League on Sunday.

279.title: Decomposed body of 23-yr-old IIT Kharagpur student found in hostel room
279.article_body: The semi-decomposed body of a 23-year-old student was found in the hostel room of IIT Kharagpur, with the police suspecting suicide. The student, identified as Faizan Ahmed, was a third-year mechanical engineering student and a resident of Assam's Tinsukia. A 20-year-old student was found hanging in his hostel room at IIT Guwahati, earlier this month.

280.title: Filmmaker Vishal Bhardwaj buys new luxury apartment for ₹19.5 cr in Mumbai
280.article_body: Vishal Bhardwaj has reportedly purchased a new luxury apartment in Mumbai's Versova. The apartment, which costs ₹19.5 crore, is located on 21st floor of the Bay View residential tower and spreads across 2,056 sq ft. Vishal has purchased the apartment with his wife and singer Rekha Bhardwaj and son Aasmaan. They'll also get three car parking slots in the tower.

281.title: Spain refuses to send riot police to help Qatar during FIFA WC
281.article_body: Spain said it will not be sending riot police to Qatar to help safeguard the FIFA World Cup as had been requested by the Middle Eastern country. Spain had reportedly been considering sending 115 officers to Qatar, which is facing a shortage of personnel. Last month, Turkey announced it would send more than 3,000 riot police to help Qatar.

282.title: Pakistan are a dangerous team: India batter Mukund ahead of T20 WC
282.article_body: India batter Abhinav Mukund said that Pakistan are a "dangerous" side ahead of upcoming T20 World Cup. He added that Pakistan's "old school" cricket has failed them many times but worked against New Zealand in tri-series final and with their "spectacular" bowling line-up, the plan might work in Australia. "Don't see many teams hitting 200 against them," he further said.

283.title: This is the beginning of something big: Bhogle on women's IPL in March 2023
283.article_body: After BCCI announced that the women's IPL will take place with five teams in March 2023, Harsha Bhogle tweeted, "Delighted to see that...WIPL is on its way." He added, "Was hoping they could've managed six teams, if not eight, with existing franchises setting up women's arm. Maybe in...future, but this is the beginning of something big...we must all support it."

284.title: Coast Guard ship frees 6 Indian fishermen from Pakistani captivity
284.article_body: An Indian Coast Guard ship managed to free Indian fishermen who were being taken to a Pakistani port by Pakistan Maritime Security Agency. The fishermen's boat, which was involved in fishing activities off the Gujarat coast, sank after it was fired on twice. One fisherman was left in an unconscious state in the water and six others were held captive.

285.title: Martin Scorsese to direct 'Gangs of New York' TV series
285.article_body: Academy Award-winning filmmaker Martin Scorsese is turning his feature 'Gangs of New York' into a TV series. He will serve as an executive producer on the project and also direct the first two episodes. The film, which was released in 2002, starred Leonardo DiCaprio, Cameron Diaz, Liam Neeson and Brendan Gleeson, among others, in key roles.

286.title: Centre approves ₹1,000 cr suspension bridge across Krishna river
286.article_body: The Centre has approved the construction of a cable-stayed-cum-suspension bridge across the Krishna river which will connect Telangana and Andhra Pradesh and pass through the Nallamala forest. Union Minister of Road Transport and Highways Nitin Gadkari said the bridge will be constructed in 30 months and cost ₹1,082.56 crore. He said the bridge will have a glass pedestrian walkway.

287.title: Punjab, Haryana CMs fail to reach a consensus on water sharing
287.article_body: The two-hour-long talks between Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann and Haryana CM Manohar Lal Khattar on Friday failed to reach a consensus on the sharing of water through the Sutlej Yamuna Link canal. Mann said the canal's construction is not required as Punjab has no excess water. "We cannot call Sutlej and Beas rivers. Now, they are just drains," he said.

288.title: Large, mysterious creature washes ashore in US' Oregon; pic goes viral
288.article_body: A couple from Oregon, US discovered a mysterious blob-like creature on the coast near Florence on October 12. They believe it's what's known as a "globster", a decomposing whale or shark that looks like it's covered in white hair. The creature was the size of a pickup truck and reeked of decomposing mammal.

289.title: Dolphins spotted at Injambakkam in Chennai; video surfaces
289.article_body: A video showing dolphins spotted at Injambakkam beach in Chennai has gone viral on social media. A journalist shared the video on Twitter. While a user said it is a common occurrence, others said they were glad that event was recorded and shared as dolphins don't usually appear near the same spot. Another user wrote, "Lovely," reacting to the video.

290.title: Ready and fully confident for Himachal polls: AAP's Durgesh Pathak
290.article_body: The Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) said it is "ready" for the Himachal Pradesh Assembly elections and "fully confident" of getting the people's mandate. Party leader Durgesh Pathak said teams formed by the party in every village of Himachal Pradesh are "working hard" to reach out to the masses. He added that Congress and the BJP had "looted" the state.

291.title: Centre sends 6-member team to manage dengue in 3 UP districts
291.article_body: The central government has deputised a high-level multi-disciplinary team to Uttar Pradesh to manage the spread of dengue in Firozabad, Agra and Etawah districts. The six-member central team will be headed by Dr VK Chaudhary of the Regional Office of Health and Family Welfare, Lucknow. The team shall work with the state health departments and recommend necessary public health interventions.

292.title: Govt launches welfare fund donation website for martyrs' families
292.article_body: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh launched 'Maa Bharati Ke Sapoot' website on Friday that will enable Indian citizens to financially contribute to the Armed Forces Battle Casualties Welfare Fund (AFBCWF). Amitabh Bachchan is the 'Goodwill Ambassador' of the portal. The website was launched at an event at National War Memorial complex. AFBCWF provides financial aid to families of battle casualties.

293.title: Arjun Tendulkar records his career-best T20 bowling figures
293.article_body: Fast bowler Arjun Tendulkar on Friday recorded his career-best bowling figures in T20 cricket. Arjun, playing his third match for Goa, recorded bowling figures of 4-1-10-4 against Hyderabad in Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy. He bowled 17 dot balls and conceded just one boundary. The 23-year-old has taken six wickets in Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy this season.

294.title: Woman molested by auto driver, dragged with vehicle in Maha; incident caught on camera
294.article_body: CCTV footage of a molestation incident in Maharashtra's Thane showed an auto driver dragging the alleged victim with his vehicle for half a kilometre. The auto driver allegedly passed a comment on the student and when she questioned him, caught hold of her hand and pulled her, police said. He raced the auto while she held onto him, police added.

295.title: Film on RSS founder KB Hedgewar in the works
295.article_body: A biopic on RSS founder KB Hedgewar is in early works. It will be made in Hindi, Marathi and English. Jayanand Shetty, producer of the film, said that the upcoming movie is a "tribute to his journey, his struggles and his movements". "Even today, Dr Hedgewar is a much revered figure in the Nationalist Movement of India," Jayanand added.

296.title: Maha lawyer sentenced to 6 months in jail for using casteist slurs
296.article_body: A court in Maharashtra's Thane sentenced a 44-year-old lawyer to six months of imprisonment for using casteist slurs against a man during an argument. The complainant had lent the lawyer ₹1 lakh, but the latter refused to return the amount and used casteist slurs. The court said a "lenient view" of such cases could lead to an "unstable social atmosphere".

297.title: Rash drivers in Kerala will have to do mandatory community service
297.article_body: The Kerala Government has reportedly decided to impose mandatory community service on drivers involved in major accidents and found driving under influence. The drivers will have to undergo a three-day service at trauma or palliative care centres. The driver will also have their licence suspended and be asked to attend a three-day training at the driving institute in Malappuram district.

298.title: Johnny Depp's pics in clean-shaven look go viral; fans say he looks unrecognisable
298.article_body: Johnny Depp debuted a new look as he kick-started a tour with his friend Jeff Beck in New York City. Several fans said he looked unrecognisable as he shaved his moustache and goatee and was seen in a clean-shaven look. "I'm not used to his shaven look," a fan reacted while another joked, "That's not Johnny Depp. End of story."

299.title: NIA raids multiple locations in J&K over drone delivery case
299.article_body: The National Investigation Agency (NIA) reportedly conducted searches at multiple locations in Jammu and Kashmir as part of its investigation into the Pakistan drone delivery case. The case pertains to over two dozen sightings of Pakistani drones dropping weapons and explosives in the valley. A man has reportedly been brought in for questioning by the agency.

300.title: Congress needs to work a lot to form regional alliances: Tharoor
300.article_body: Congress leader Shashi Tharoor said the party has to "work a lot" to form alliances with regional parties ahead of the 2024 general elections. He added that "it is very necessary" that Congress stops leaders from leaving the party. He also said Congress is the only party that can put up a good fight against the BJP.

301.title: New Ugandan law criminalises certain online activities
301.article_body: Ugandan President Yoweri Museveni on Thursday passed a law that criminalises certain internet activities such as spreading "hateful and unwarranted information". The new law proposes prison sentences of up to 10 years in certain cases where users are found transmitting information about a person without their consent. The related bill was passed by the country's legislature in September this year.

302.title: 8 colonial-era mummies unearthed in Peru
302.article_body: Archaeologists have unearthed eight centuries-old mummies in Peru. The ancient preserved corpses also included the remains of children. "This finding backs our hypothesis that this could be [a] cemetery from the colonial period," a researcher said. The mummies were found in unusual positions and with a mix of textiles that pointed to the influence of Spanish colonials, an official said.

303.title: SC refuses urgent hearing of plea on firecrackers' ban
303.article_body: The Supreme Court (SC) on Friday refused to urgently hear a plea related to the ban on firecrackers announced by various state governments. "People must have invested money...you should have come...earlier," the SC said, adding that Diwali was around the corner. Earlier, the court had refused to stay the Delhi government's order which banned firecrackers till January 1.

304.title: Middle order was outstanding: Babar on Pak's win vs NZ in tri-series final
304.article_body: After Pakistan defeated New Zealand by five wickets in the tri-series final, Pakistan captain Babar Azam said his side deserves all the credit for the way they played. "The bowlers were brilliant at the death. The way the middle order played was outstanding. Haider Ali and Muhammad Nawaz are outstanding," he added. All-rounder Nawaz was adjudged 'Player of the Match'.

305.title: Ban on animal slaughter, transport to fight lumpy skin disease: K'taka Minister
305.article_body: Karnataka Minister of Animal Husbandry Prabhu B Chavan on Thursday assured cattle owners that the government is banning animal slaughter and transport to combat lumpy skin disease. Respective district administrations have been instructed to ban cattle fairs, markets and transportation to prevent the further spread of the disease, he said, adding live vaccine is being given as preventive medicine.

306.title: Bira 91 acquires retail bar chain The Beer Cafe in all-stock deal
306.article_body: Premium beer manufacturing company Bira 91 has acquired India's largest alcobev retail chain The Beer Cafe in an all-stock deal. The bar and restaurant chain will become a fully owned subsidiary of Bira 91. "The deal will enable Bira 91 to strengthen its play in pubs and build a direct-to-consumer platform focused on beer," Bira 91 CEO Ankur Jain said.

307.title: India's Esow finishes 12th in keirin final at Cycling Track World C'ships
307.article_body: Indian cyclist Esow Alban finished 12th in the 7th-12th place men's keirin ranking final at ongoing Cycling Track World Championships 2022 in France on Thursday. The 21-year-old made history when he became the first-ever Indian to qualify for the semi-final of the tournament earlier in the day. Notably, this is Alban's maiden senior World Championships.

308.title: Fire breaks out at Gujarat's Old Secretariat; files & furniture burnt
308.article_body: One of the floors of Gujarat's Old Secretariat building reported a fire on Friday. Gandhinagar's chief fire officer said the fire broke out at the Gram Vikas office due to a suspected electrical fault. Files and furniture of the rural department were reportedly burnt. No casualties were reported. A video from the scene showed smoke emanating from the building.

309.title: 35-yr-old man held for rape, murder of minor girl in UP's Mathura
309.article_body: A 35-year-old man was arrested on Friday for allegedly raping and killing a 10-year-old girl in Uttar Pradesh's Mathura, police said. The naked body of the girl was found in a forest area on Thursday and the family members had alleged rape before murder, police added. During interrogation, the man confessed to killing the girl after raping her, SSP said.

310.title: What is India's schedule at T20 World Cup 2022?
310.article_body: India will begin their T20 World Cup 2022 campaign with Super 12 stage Group 2 match against Pakistan on October 23. India will then face Group A runners-up of first round on October 27, and South Africa and Bangladesh on October 30 and November 2, respectively. India will then face Group B winners of first round on November 6.

311.title: Crew told us to pray, it was embarrassing: Passenger of smoke-filled SpiceJet flight
311.article_body: One of the passengers of the Goa-Hyderabad SpiceJet flight that detected smoke mid-air on Wednesday, said, "The crew members told us to pray to God...It was mortifying." The airline has, however, denied the claim, calling it "unfounded". Another passenger reportedly said the crew told passengers to "jump and run" as soon as the emergency doors opened.

312.title: BJP brought development, other parties unleashed violence: Tripura CM
312.article_body: Tripura CM Manik Saha said the BJP-led government in Tripura has ushered in many development initiatives since 2018 and all other parties have a long history of political violence. "The only option for people is...BJP, guided by leaders like Narendra Modi, Amit Shah and JP Nadda," he added. He urged people to vote for the BJP in upcoming Assembly elections.

313.title: 4 PFI offices sealed in Tamil Nadu's Coimbatore
313.article_body:
The district administration on Friday sealed four offices of banned Popular Front of India (PFI) in Tamil Nadu's Coimbatore. A team led by the South Tehsildar reportedly sealed the two PFI offices at Kottaimedu and Vincent Road. PFI offices at Mettupalayam and Pollachi were also sealed.
Police were deployed at the above places and also in sensitive areas, officials said.

314.title: ESA spacecraft takes fiery visuals of Sun before close fly-by
314.article_body: ESA's Solar Orbiter took a sequence of images that show the sun blazing with solar explosions before making its last close approach to the Sun on Friday. The colours in the images were, however, added artificially because the original wavelength of the light emitted by the gas in the Sun's atmosphere is invisible to the human eye.

315.title: Rahul Gandhi can never be on par with PM Modi: Union Minister
315.article_body: Union Minister of State for Agriculture and Farmers Welfare Shobha Karandlaje said Congress MP Rahul Gandhi can never attain the stature of PM Narendra Modi. "Rahul shows only his physical fitness. Can he lead the country?" Shobha asked. She added that the people of India will decide whether Rahul has the mental fitness to rule the country.

316.title: Man fined ₹20,000 over SC plea to declare Satyendar Jain 'of unsound mind'
316.article_body: The Supreme Court on Friday, reacting to a plea seeking to declare Delhi minister Satyendar Jain as a "person with unsound mind" and disqualify him from the Assembly on this ground, called it "ridiculous". Jain is in judicial custody in a money laundering case since May 30. The petition deserves to be dismissed with a cost of ₹20,000, SC added.

317.title: We can't cry over it for next 3 years: Director Puri on Liger's failure
317.article_body: Director Puri Jagannadh, speaking about the failure of his film 'Liger', said, "We can't cry over it for next three years." "If I look back, the days I was happier are more than the days I was sad," he added. Starring Vijay Deverakonda and Ananya Panday in the lead roles, the action film reportedly collected around ₹20 crore in India.

318.title: India need to pick up their fielding ahead of T20 WC: Ravi Shastri
318.article_body: Ahead of the T20 World Cup, ex-coach Ravi Shastri said that India need to pick up their fielding and have to start right from the beginning in that aspect of the game. "Those 15-20 runs you save will make all the difference...This is where other sides [like] Australia, England and New Zealand [are ahead]...They field like crazy," Shastri said.

319.title: 5 injured as vehicles in UP Dy CM's convoy collide with each other
319.article_body: Three police personnel, a doctor and a health worker were injured after two vehicles, including an ambulance, collided with each other in Uttar Pradesh's Sitapur on Friday. The vehicles were part of Deputy Chief Minister Brajesh Pathak's convoy. BJP MLA Shashank Trivedi and Sitapur CMO Dr Madhu Gairola visited the district hospital, where the injured persons are admitted.

320.title: Vicky Kaushal and Aanand L Rai team up for a love story: Report
320.article_body: Actor Vicky Kaushal and filmmaker Aanand L Rai are reportedly teaming up for a love story. The film will go on floors in 2023. "The hunt for the female lead is underway. Like all his (Aanand) previous films, this one too has a strong character full of substance for the female counterpart," a source was quoted as saying.

321.title: Farmer murdered with spade over argument in UP's Fatehpur
321.article_body: A farmer was murdered in Senpur village in UP's Fatehpur district. The deceased, Ramasray Yadav (50), was working in his field where he had an argument with four other villagers before they attacked him with a spade, police said. Notably, Yadav was declared dead at a hospital. Police have registered a case and have formed teams to arrest the accused.

322.title: You're polluting minds of young generation: SC to Ekta Kapoor on 'XXX' web series
322.article_body: Supreme Court has criticised producer Ekta Kapoor over "objectionable content" in her web series 'XXX' saying she was polluting minds of young generation. It was hearing a plea challenging arrest warrants issued against her for allegedly insulting soldiers in the web series. "OTT...content is available to all. What kind of choice are you providing to the people?" the court said.

323.title: Ricky Kej tweets clip of cockroach in flight, IndiGo says, 'insects find a way at times'
323.article_body: Grammy-winning Indian-origin composer Ricky Kej on Friday shared a video of a cockroach crawling inside a Patna to Delhi IndiGo flight and said, "I am sure it got a complimentary meal." Replying to him, IndiGo said, "While stringent cleaning and fumigation is done before every flight, at times, these insects find a way inside...our crew...[are] always there to help."

324.title: Kohli talks to Pandya for 20 minutes after India's defeat in warm-up match, video viral
324.article_body: A video has gone viral showing former Team India captain Virat Kohli talking to all-rounder Hardik Pandya for 20 minutes on the ground after India's defeat in their warm-up match against Western Australia. In the video shared by journalist Vimal Kumar, Kohli can apparently be seen giving batting tips to Pandya. Notably, Kohli did not feature in the warm-up match.

325.title: 20-yr-old man arrested for hoax call of terror attack on Gorakhnath Temple
325.article_body: A 20-year-old man was reportedly arrested for making a hoax call of a terror attack on Uttar Pradesh's Gorakhnath Temple. He called emergency number 112, identified himself as senior police officer Pradyumna and gave information about terrorists planning to blow up the temple on Diwali. When police reached his home and found he had given false information, they arrested him.

326.title: India can definitely finish on podium at hockey WC 2023: Baskaran
326.article_body: Ex-Indian men's hockey team captain and coach Vasudevan Baskaran said he believes that India can definitely finish on the podium at hockey World Cup 2023 in Odisha. "They should move on from the CWG final loss to Australia and ride on the confidence they gained from the Tokyo Olympic Games," he added. India finished sixth at World Cup in 2018.

327.title: AAP councillor's car among 24 vehicles vandalised in Chandigarh
327.article_body: Over two dozen four-wheeler vehicles, including a car belonging to AAP councillor Suman Devi, were vandalised by unknown persons in Chandigarh's Subhash Nagar between 2 am and 3.30 am on Friday. According to local residents, front and rear mirrors, windowpanes and roofs were damaged in the incident. "It could be an act of jealousy or revenge," SHO Rohtash Yadav said.

328.title: 30 Nepali principals, teachers visit government schools in Delhi
328.article_body: A Nepali delegation of 30 school principals, vice principals and educators is visiting government schools in Delhi to learn "best practices", said the Directorate of Education. The delegation noted several school programmes such as 'Deshbhakti' and International Baccalaureate. A delegation member said they want to "understand the ground-level implementation process of unique curricula".

329.title: Committee formed to study gaps in Gurugram's drainage system
329.article_body: Commissioner of Gurugram division Ramesh Chander Bidhan has formed a panel to study shortcomings in the city's drainage system and suggest remedial measures. The decision comes after the city reported heavy waterlogging twice in the last two months. As per plans, the committee will examine rainfall data, the city's topography and the lateral stormwater drainage capacity.

330.title: Bengaluru civic body sets Oct 31 deadline to complete key ongoing projects
330.article_body: Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike has set October 31 as the deadline to complete work on some key ongoing projects in the city. The decision came after BBMP Chief Commissioner Tushar Giri Nath reviewed the works of the BBMP project division. The projects include Shivananda Circle to Race Course Junction Flyover and the Intermediate Ring Road from Domlur flyover to Ejipura.

331.title: SC scolds lawyer appearing virtually, says 'we're here 10am-5pm, you come for 5 mins'
331.article_body: The Supreme Court (SC) on Friday took strong exception to a senior lawyer appearing before it virtually and refused to proceed with the matter, asking him to be physically present in court. "We're sitting in court from 10 am to 5 pm. This is unacceptable...You people just come on screen for five minutes and go back somewhere," said SC.

332.title: Hospital staff, neighbours attack each other over parking issue in Hyd
332.article_body: A doctor and employees of a private hospital and its neighbours attacked each other on Thursday over a parking dispute at Lal Darwaza, Hyderabad. The neighbours had reportedly obstructed entrance to the facility by parking their vehicles there. A CCTV footage showed people entering the hospital and physically abusing the staff. The staff and a 70-year-old man were allegedly injured.

333.title: Mumbai woman cheated of ₹2.3 lakh over 'friend's gifts' from Poland
333.article_body: A Mumbai-based woman was cheated of more than ₹2 lakh after a fraudster asked her to pay customs duty for ‘gifts’ he sent her from Poland. The complainant became ‘friends’ with the man on social media. The man initially asked her to pay ₹45,000 as customs duty and then threatened her with a money laundering case to pay more.

334.title: You're polluting minds of youngsters: SC to Ektaa Kapoor on 'XXX' web series
334.article_body: Supreme Court on Friday criticised producer Ektaa Kapoor over objectionable content in 'XXX' web series and said, "You're polluting the minds of the young generation of this country." The court added, "OTT content is available to all. What kind of choice are you providing to the people?" The web series faced criticism for reportedly featuring several objectionable scenes insulting Army.

335.title: Sonia won from Ballari in 1999 but she did not look at it again: Yediyurappa
335.article_body: Ex-CM BS Yediyurappa said that Congress President Sonia Gandhi was elected from Karnataka's Ballari in the 1999 general elections but she did not look at the constituency again. "When Rahul Gandhi comes to Ballari ask him why his mother never returned...You must...remember that...[BJP] has always made persons belonging to the SC/ST communities the President of the country," Yediyurappa said.

336.title: Pune Police to make SOP to investigate 'sextortion' cases
336.article_body: Pune Police said a standard operating procedure (SOP) is being prepared to investigate 'sextortion' cases. The decision comes after two students in separate incidents allegedly died by suicide in the last month in the Pune district. Later, the probe in the cases revealed they were victims of extortion where criminals threatened to leak their objectionable photos online.

337.title: Seat belts must for all Mumbai car passengers from Nov 1, violators to be punished
337.article_body: The Mumbai Police on Friday said wearing seat belts will be compulsory for drivers and co-passengers in four-wheeler vehicles from November 1. In a notification, police warned of action against violators under the Motor Vehicles (Amendment) Act. The notification further instructed all motorists and vehicle owners to install seat belt facility in four-wheelers before November 1.

338.title: 21-yr-old Virat Kohli fan murders Rohit Sharma fan following drunken brawl in TN, arrested
338.article_body: A 21-year-old Virat Kohli fan named Dharmaraj has been arrested for allegedly killing his friend Vignesh, who was a Rohit Sharma fan, following a drunken brawl in Tamil Nadu's Mallur over who was a better cricketer out of Kohli and Rohit. Police stated during their brawl, Vignesh mocked RCB and Kohli, and had made remarks comparing RCB to Dharmaraj's stammering.

339.title: I didn't, he blocked me: Charu on reports she unfollowed Rajeev on Instagram
339.article_body: Actress Charu Asopa has reacted to reports that claimed she unfollowed her husband Rajeev Sen on Instagram. "I did not unfollow him, he blocked me," she said. "He has gone to Delhi and waha jaane ke baad he...blocked me. I have no clue what he's doing or where he is," Charu added. The duo had earlier called off their divorce.

340.title: No action against senior bureaucrats involved in corruption in J&K: Mufti
340.article_body: PDP chief Mehbooba Mufti on Friday criticised Jammu and Kashmir administration and said that no action has been taken against senior bureaucrats involved in corruption. Low rank officers are fired without any investigation, she said. Mufti's comment came after the government ordered premature retirement of 36 police personnel for their alleged involvement in corruption and lack of performance.

341.title: A champion in every sense: Yuvraj to Gambhir on his 41st birthday
341.article_body: Yuvraj Singh took to Twitter to wish Gautam Gambhir on his 41st birthday and wrote, "Wishing a very happy birthday to my dear brother Gautam Gambhir - a champion in every sense! Lots of love GG." Suresh Raina tweeted, "Wishing Gambhir all the love and success on his birthday today! A true friend and a gracious human being."

342.title: BMC begins demolition around Mahim Fort as part of restoration
342.article_body: Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) has begun the demolition of structures around the Mahim Fort as part of the restoration process. On Thursday, the BMC demolished 21 of the 267 residential structures and the rest will be demolished over the next month. "The fort is in an extremely dilapidated state...the civic body is manually carrying out the demolition," said an official.

343.title: UP CM visits flood-affected villages of Gorakhpur & Maharajganj
343.article_body: Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath on Friday visited the flood-affected villages of Gorakhpur, Maharajganj and distributed relief materials to flood victims. "Facing the challenge of disaster firmly, the double engine government of the Centre and...state is engaged in the service of...people," he said. Officials have been asked to provide ₹4 lakh compensation to families of flood victims, he added.

344.title: PMC appoints new brand ambassadors for Swachh Survey 2023
344.article_body: The Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) has appointed tennis player Rutuja Bhosale and singer Saleel Kulkarni as brand ambassadors for next year’s Swacch Survey. "To create awareness among the citizens and authorities, PMC has appointed these brand ambassadors," said municipal official Asha Raut. Bhosale and Kulkarni are expected to participate in the PMC’s cleanliness awareness programmes.

345.title: Protestors throw soup at Van Gogh's $84 mn painting, glue themselves to wall in UK
345.article_body: 'Just Stop Oil' activists threw soup over Vincent van Gogh's 'Sunflowers' painting, estimated to be worth over $84 million, at London's National Gallery, and appeared to glue themselves to the wall. It's protected by glass and wasn't damaged, the gallery said. "What's worth more, art or life? Is it worth more than food? More than justice?" said an activist.

346.title: India test-fires Submarine Launched Ballistic Missile from INS Arihant
346.article_body: India on Friday successfully test-fired a Submarine Launched Ballistic Missile (SLBM) from nuclear submarine INS Arihant. The Ministry of Defence said the missile was tested to a predetermined range and impacted the target area in the Bay of Bengal with very high accuracy. All operational and technological parameters of the weapon system have been validated, the ministry added.

347.title: Mind-blowing, a must-watch: Dhanush on Rishab Shetty's 'Kantara'
347.article_body: Actor Dhanush took to Twitter to praise Rishab Shetty's 'Kantara', saying, "Mind-blowing!! A must-watch." "Rishab Shetty, you should be very proud of yourself. Congratulations Hombale Films (production house)...keep pushing the boundaries. A big hug to all the actors and technicians of the film," he added. Besides playing the lead, Rishab has written and directed the film.

348.title: 'RIP Cartoon Network' trends as merger announced with Warner Bros, networks respond
348.article_body: Cartoon Network Studios fans trended 'RIP Cartoon Network' after it was announced that it'll merge with Warner Bros Animation and both labels will be run independently, albeit under the same President.
