People on Twitter mourned the 'killing' of Cartoon Network, even as its Art Director criticised a report for "spreading panic". Warner Brothers have also denied the channel is folding.

349.title: Shalin & I are simply making an effort to be cordial for our son: Dalljiet
349.article_body: After Bigg Boss 16 contestant Shalin Bhanot claimed that he and his ex-wife, Dalljiet, are best friends, the latter denied it, saying they're simply making an effort to be cordial for their son. Dalljiet added they only see each other because she wants their son to have a good relationship with Shalin and doesn't want him to witness Dalljiet-Shalin controversies.

350.title: Body of unidentified man found in Kolshet creek in Thane
350.article_body: The body of an unidentified man was found in the creek in Kolshet, Thane on Friday. The body was found at around 1 pm at Ganpati Visarjan ghat and further probe into the matter is being conducted by the police department, a civic official said. An accidental death case has been registered, a police official added.

351.title: Will accept whatever decision comes: Warner on captaincy restoration decision
351.article_body: Amid the talks about his lifetime ban from captaining Australia being revoked, batter David Warner said that he will accept whatever decision is being taken by Cricket Australia. "If it does get overturned, that'll be great for me...If I ever get presented with that (captain of the Australian white ball teams) opportunity, it will be a privilege," Warner said.

352.title: Touched at being called daughter of Assam by CM Sarma: Prez Murmu
352.article_body: President Droupadi Murmu said that she was touched by the gesture of Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma calling her a daughter of the state. "The welcome I have received here has made me feel at home and I will return soon," President Murmu said. She added that a society that respects its women is considered a civilised one.

353.title: Navi Mumbai Municipal Corporation officers, staffers to get Diwali bonus
353.article_body: Navi Mumbai Municipal Corporation (NMMC) Commissioner Rajesh Narvekar announced that officers and staffers of NMMC are set to get an ex-gratia payment before Diwali. As per the order, NMMC officers and employees, primary and secondary teachers will get a grant amount of ₹27,000. Similarly, employees and health workers on daily wages will be provided with an amount of ₹21,000.

354.title: Saudi Arabia pushed other OPEC nations into decision on oil cuts: US
354.article_body: The US has accused Saudi Arabia of pushing other OPEC+ nations into the decision to cut oil production target. The US National Security Council spokesperson John Kirby said more than one OPEC member disagreed with Saudi Arabia's decision and felt coerced into vote. "The Saudi foreign ministry can try to spin or deflect, but the facts are simple," Kirby added.

355.title: When father takes care of child, society blows it out of proportion: Neha Dhupia
355.article_body: Actress Neha Dhupia said she finds it "problematic" when people think that it's only her duty to take care of her kids. Neha said that after her daughter was born, people would look at her and ask, "Where's the baby? Who's watching over her?" "Society blows it out of proportion when the father...[takes care of the child]," she added.

356.title: Hyderabad Police arrest 2 persons involved in online fraud, cheating
356.article_body: Hyderabad's Rachakonda Police on Friday arrested two persons, identified as Bhagwan Sahya Sharma and Sachin Saini, involved in online fraud and cheating. The accused, who hailed from Jaipur, reportedly targeted victims by sending fake messages asking them to update their bank documents. Police seized three mobile phones, six credit cards, four debit cards, one voter ID and  ₹50,000 cash.

357.title: Belarus in state of heightened terrorism alert: President Lukashenko
357.article_body: Belarusian President Aleksandr Lukashenko said that he had placed Belarus in a state of heightened terrorism alert because of tensions on its border with Ukraine. Lukashenko linked the decision to an announcement in which he ordered Belarusian troops to deploy with Russian forces near the southern border. "Everything is going according to plan," Lukashenko added.

358.title: UK Finance Minister Kwasi Kwarteng fired after less than 6 weeks on the job
358.article_body: UK Finance Minister Kwasi Kwarteng has been fired by PM Liz Truss after less than six weeks on the job, multiple reports said on Friday, amid market unrest over the government's massive tax cuts. Kwarteng became the UK's shortest-serving Chancellor of the Exchequer since 1970. The UK will now elect its fourth Finance Minister in as many months.

359.title: IT conducts raids at premises of JD(U) chief’s close aide in Patna
359.article_body: The Income Tax (IT) Department carried out searches at the premises of a builder, Gabbu Singh, who is a close aide of JD(U) National President Lalan Singh. The raids were conducted at the premises of the builder in Shivpuri, Patel Nagar and Boring Road. The development comes months after the JD(U) severed ties with the BJP and joined the Mahagathbandhan.

360.title: Drugs worth ₹900 crore seized since May 2021: Assam CM
360.article_body: Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma has claimed that drugs worth ₹900 crore were seized and a total of 6,800 people have been arrested in the state since May 2021. Earlier on August 2, the Assam Police had seized drugs worth ₹15 crore in the Karbi Anglong district during a joint operation with the CRPF.

361.title: Videos of fog, flooded roads in B'luru emerge online after heavy rain
361.article_body: Videos and pictures showing thick fog and mist in Bengaluru on Friday morning after heavy rain in the city have emerged on social media. "Visibility is hardly 50 metres," a Twitter user wrote. Visuals of waterlogged roads in areas like Indiranagar were also shared online by locals. The rain also led to traffic congestion on Outer Ring Road on Thursday.

362.title: 29-yr-old Delhi man caught with 103 kg firecrackers despite ban, arrested
362.article_body: A 29-year-old man was arrested for carrying around 103-kilograms of firecrackers with the intention to sell them despite the ban in the national capital. While patrolling the Sadar Bazar area, police noticed the man carrying plastic bags. Upon checking, they found firecrackers in the bag. He said he brought firecrackers from Lucknow to the national capital for sale.

363.title: KL Rahul could be top run-scorer for India at T20 WC 2022: Aakash Chopra
363.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Aakash Chopra has said opener KL Rahul could be the top run-scorer for India at upcoming T20 World Cup 2022 in Australia. "He has an opportunity to bat all 20 overs, and...also has the game to bat till the end. These pitches will suit him a lot as the ball will come nicely onto the bat," he added.

364.title: No plans to buy Jaiprakash Associates' cement unit: Adani Enterprises
364.article_body: Adani Enterprises clarified it is not evaluating plans to buy Jaiprakash Associates' cement unit. This development comes amid reports that the firm was in advanced discussion with Jaiprakash Power Ventures to acquire its cement unit for around ₹5,000 crore. Adani Enterprises said, "Company isn't evaluating any such proposal...not in a position to comment on the veracity of said media report."

365.title: India-UK FTA no longer has a Diwali deadline: UK Trade Secretary
365.article_body: India-UK free trade agreement (FTA) is no longer working towards a Diwali deadline, UK Trade Secretary Kemi Badenoch said. "We're still working on a deal...things that have changed...we're no longer working to the Diwali deadline," Badenoch said. This comes amid reports of possible deadlock over issues like data localisation and UK firms being allowed to bid for Indian government contracts.

366.title: 9 students drown after ferry capsizes in Cambodia
366.article_body: At least nine children in southern Cambodia who were crossing a river died after the boat they were on capsized on Thursday, officials said. The students, aged between 12 and 14, were on their way to an English class when their boat capsized on the Mekong River. Four people, two students and two of the boat's crew, have been rescued.

367.title: Photographer captures 'ghost rainbow' in US, pic goes viral
367.article_body: A photographer named Stu Berman shared the photo of a 'ghost rainbow' captured by him in California. Also called fogbow or white rainbow, it's caused by the same physical process as the rainbow, except the water droplets that form the fogbow are very small. This causes heightened diffraction that leads to the appearance of weak colours or no colours.

368.title: Will approach SC: Lawyer after Gyanvapi 'Shivling' carbon dating rejection
368.article_body: After a Varanasi Court rejected the plea of Hindu worshippers regarding carbon dating of 'Shivling' in the Gyanvapi mosque case, Advocate Vishnu Jain said that they will now move to Supreme Court against this order and challenge it there. "I cannot announce the date as of now, but we'll soon challenge this order in Supreme Court," he added.

369.title: Couple blackmails MLAs, film producers using intimate pics & extort crores in Odisha
369.article_body: A woman in her 20s and her husband were recently arrested for allegedly extorting crores of rupees from influential people such as MLAs, businessmen and film producers in Odisha, police said. The couple, identified as Archana Nag and Jagabandu Chand, allegedly ran a sex racket to extort influential persons by threatening to make their intimate pictures public.

370.title: Felt cheated, nobody expected it to be animated film: Vishnu on 'Adipurush'
370.article_body: Telugu actor Vishnu Manchu said in an interview that he "felt cheated" when he saw the teaser of 'Adipurush'. He added that nobody expected it to be an animated film. "We all thought...it'll be a mainstream live-action movie," said Vishnu. "If you would've said...it was an animated film, and then released the teaser, there would've been zero trolls," he added.

371.title: Class 10 boy's kidneys swell after being forced to do 200 sit-ups in Guj school
371.article_body: A Class 10 student was hospitalised after he was allegedly made to do 200 sit-ups as punishment by a school teacher in Gujarat's Una. The boy has been diagnosed with swelling in his kidneys. His father alleged that about seven to 10 days ago, when his son returned from school, he complained of cramps in his legs and vomited constantly.

372.title: Never thought we would see 4 sixes in final over at T20 WC 2016: Sammy
372.article_body: Ex-West Indies skipper Daren Sammy remembered the last over of the 2016 T20 World Cup final where Carlos Brathwaite helped his team to win the title by smashing four sixes. "I remember Chris [Gayle] saying that 19 [runs in the last over] is a lot. But...Man oh man, I never thought we would see four [consecutive] sixes," Sammy said.

373.title: Rasika Dugal wraps up shooting for 'Mirzapur 3'
373.article_body: Actress Rasika Dugal has completed shooting for the third season of the web series 'Mirzapur'. The actress, who plays a character named Beena Tripathi on the show, said that she will miss being on the sets and collaborating with her "favourite people". In addition to Rasika, 'Mirzapur 3' will also feature Pankaj Tripathi and Ali Fazal, among others.

374.title: Govt says OTP can be stolen via calls, urges public to stay alert & aware
374.article_body: Press Information Bureau shared a video on Twitter saying that One Time Password (OTP) can be stolen via calls. "Never merge any other calls while talking to a stranger on the phone...Once the call is merged, the fraudster can hack your social media account by knowing the OTP...Be aware, be alert," the tweet read.

375.title: Crimea bridge repairs will be completed by July next year: Russia
375.article_body: Repairs to the bridge linking southern Russia with the annexed Crimean peninsula will be completed by July 2023, a document published on the Russian government's website said. The bridge was damaged in an explosion last Saturday. Russian President Vladimir Putin blamed Ukraine's special services for the Crimea bridge blast and called it an "act of terrorism".

376.title: Russia to evacuate Kherson residents amid Ukraine's advances
376.article_body: Russian Deputy Prime Minister Marat Khusnullin announced that the country would provide free accommodation to residents of the Kherson region who want to evacuate to Russia. The announcement came after Russia-backed leader of Kherson, one of the Ukrainian regions annexed by Russia, asked the Kremlin to organise evacuation. The request came after Ukrainian forces began counteroffensive in Kherson.

377.title: Mohammad Shami replaces Jasprit Bumrah in India's T20 World Cup 2022 squad
377.article_body: The BCCI on Friday named fast bowler Mohammad Shami as Jasprit Bumrah's replacement in India's T20 World Cup 2022 squad. Shami has reached Australia and will link up with the squad in Brisbane ahead of the warm-up matches, the BCCI said. Further, Mohammed Siraj and Shardul Thakur have been named as backups and will travel to Australia shortly.

378.title: Electric vehicle makers face penalty after probe into recent fire incidents
378.article_body: The Ministry of Road Transport and Highways has imposed a penalty on EV makers after an investigation into several two-wheelers catching fire, a report said. The government had formed high-level committee to review testing standards after at least 10 incidents of fire in EVs were reported between March and June. Penalty imposed under Central Motor Vehicles Rules has been collected.

379.title: 25-yr-old man climbs building via pipes, records girl taking bath in Goa; held
379.article_body: A 25-year-old man, Cipson Gomes, has been arrested for allegedly climbing on a building using pipes and recording a video of a girl while she was taking bath in Goa. Reports said that the video was taken when the girl was taking a bath in the washroom of a girls' hostel, reports added.

380.title: I-T Dept raids stores of garment retailer RS Brothers in Hyderabad
380.article_body: The Income Tax Department on Friday conducted searches at multiple stores and offices of garment and jewellery retailer RS Brothers. As per reports, raids were conducted over investments made by the company in the real estate business. Income Tax officials reportedly checked the transactions made by RS Brothers. They also searched the offices of some real estate firms.

381.title: Worked every day for 8 years, was depressed; developed health issues: Nargis
381.article_body: Actress Nargis Fakhri said that she worked every single day for eight years. "I hardly got to be with my family. I felt unwell due to stress. Consequently, I developed health issues. Was I depressed? I guess you can use the word. I was unhappy in my situation...I took two years off to get healthy," she added.

382.title: Thought I'll reach my peak at 24: 21-yr-old Swiatek after her 61st win in 2022
382.article_body: After her Tour-leading 61st win of the year, world number one Iga Swiatek said, "I wasn't expecting to have this kind of season this year." She added, "I thought, maybe, I'm going to be at my peak when I'm 24, 25." The 21-year-old's 61 wins are the most in a single season since Caroline Wozniacki's 60 in 2017.

383.title: US-based Bitcoin firm NYDIG lays off around 33% of its staff: Report
383.article_body: US-based Bitcoin company NYDIG laid off 110 employees, a third of its workforce, last month to cut costs, The Wall Street Journal reported. The company took the decision weeks before replacing its top two executives. Last year, NYDIG raised $1 billion in a funding round which increased the company's valuation to more than $7 billion.

384.title: Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma's security upgraded to 'Z+'
384.article_body: The Centre has upgraded the security of Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma from the 'Z' category cover to the 'Z+' category on an India basis. According to reports, the move comes after the security arrangement was reviewed by the Union Home Ministry. Sarma will be guarded by over 50 commandos whenever he travels within the country.

385.title: NCLT approves ArcelorMittal's ₹4,050-cr resolution plan for Uttam Galva
385.article_body: NCLT's Mumbai bench has reportedly approved the ₹4,050-crore resolution plan by ArcelorMittal's Indian arm for the debt-ridden Uttam Galva Steels. After Essar Steel and Odisha Slurry Pipeline Infrastructure, this is ArcelorMittal's third purchase through the insolvency process. NCLT had admitted an insolvency petition against Uttam Galva on SBI's plea in October 2020.

386.title: Infosys not to mandate return to office, flexible approach to continue: CEO
386.article_body: Infosys CEO Salil Parekh said the company has not mandated any fixed number of days that employees need to attend office physically and will continue with its flexible approach. "In our India offices, we have about 45,000 employees in the office at any given time...We are finding that the approach taken so far has been well received," Parekh said.

387.title: Govt to launch 5th Vande Bharat train on November 10: Reports
387.article_body: The fifth Vande Bharat Express train is likely to be launched on November 10 and would run on the Chennai-Bengaluru-Mysuru route. According to reports, the train will cover a total distance of 483 km. Earlier on Thursday, Prime Minister Narendra Modi flagged off the fourth edition of Vande Bharat Express at the Amb Andaura railway station in Himachal Pradesh.

388.title: NGT imposes ₹500 cr fine on K'taka for failure to protect Chandapura lake
388.article_body: The National Green Tribunal (NGT) has imposed an environmental compensation fine of ₹500 crore on the Karnataka government for its failure in protecting Chandapura lake in Anekal taluka. "The state has failed to protect the environment...Lake ecology and ecosystem have hugely suffered. The state is thus, to be held liable to pay environmental compensation," NGT said.

389.title: We will not be intimidated by nuclear threats: NATO to Russia
389.article_body: NATO Secretary-General Jens Stoltenberg on Thursday said the military alliance "will not be intimidated" by Russia's nuclear threats. "Russia's nuclear rhetoric is dangerous, reckless and they know that if they use [a] nuclear weapon against Ukraine, it will have severe consequences," he added. Stoltenberg also said that NATO will "very closely" monitor Russia's upcoming annual nuclear exercise.

390.title: 2 arrested in UP for objectionable remarks against Mulayam Singh
390.article_body: Two men have been arrested in Uttar Pradesh's Ballia district for allegedly making objectionable remarks on Facebook against Samajwadi Party founder Mulayam Singh Yadav, who passed away earlier this week. According to police, the accused compared Yadav to Ravana, the demon king in Ramayana. Both accused, Markandeya Swarnkar and Ajay Verma, are residents of Nagra, said police.

391.title: Pitbull dog attacks 11-year-old girl in Ghaziabad
391.article_body: A pitbull dog reportedly attacked an 11-year-old girl in Civitech Society in Ghaziabad on Wednesday. She was playing and taking a stroll along with her pets in the society when the dog bit her on both legs. Her family claimed negligence by the dog's owner as it was left out without a leash. The girl was taken to a hospital.

392.title: Rowdy sheeter arrested in Hyderabad; dummy pistol, dagger seized
392.article_body: The Hyderabad Detective Department Special Team (south) arrested a rowdy sheeter and seized a dagger and a dummy pistol from him. According to the police, 30-year-old Shaik Ahmed Bin Omar Bawazeer was absconding after a case was booked against him for outraging modesty of a woman. He was also allegedly involved in four cases, including two murder cases.

393.title: Bombay High Court acquits ex-DU professor GN Saibaba in UAPA case
393.article_body: Bombay High Court's Nagpur bench on Friday acquitted former Delhi University professor GN Saibaba in a UAPA case and ordered his immediate release from Nagpur Central Jail. The court also allowed the appeal of five other convicts in the case and acquitted them. Saibaba was convicted for alleged Maoist links in 2017 and sentenced to life imprisonment.

394.title: Mumbai gym trainer held for cheating woman of ₹13 lakh by promising visa
394.article_body: A 28-year-old gym trainer, who cheated a 30-year-old woman of ₹13 lakh by promising to get her a Canadian visa, has been arrested in Mumbai, police said. The complainant had hired the accused, Kiran Mandavkar, as her personal gym trainer two years ago, to whom she paid ₹13 lakh till November 2021. "We're...investigating if he cheated more persons," police said.

395.title: Pakistani senator arrested for tweeting against Army chief Bajwa
395.article_body: A senior member of ousted Pakistani PM Imran Khan's party Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf has been arrested for a "highly obnoxious and intimidating" tweet against the country's Army chief, General Qamar Javed Bajwa. After a court acquitted PM Shehbaz Sharif and his son in a money laundering case on Wednesday, Senator Azam Swati congratulated Bajwa for "freeing criminals" and "legitimising corruption".

396.title: Talk of UK exit speculative, engaging with govt on subsidy: Tata Steel
396.article_body: Amid news reports of Tata Steel's exit from the UK market, CFO Koushik Chatterjee said the company is still actively engaging with the UK government regarding the subsidy issue and any talk of exit is speculative, Moneycontrol reported. Tata Steel UK has asked for £1.5 billion from British government for the transition to green energy, without which it might exit.

397.title: 1 lakh jobs, old pension scheme if we form govt in Himachal: Priyanka
397.article_body: Congress General Secretary Priyanka Gandhi Vadra on Friday promised one lakh government jobs and implementation of the old pension scheme if the party is voted to power in the upcoming Himachal Pradesh Assembly elections. Addressing a rally in Solan, Gandhi said, "BJP doesn't have money for pension but can waive off loans of their big businessmen."

398.title: PMC, NHAI form teams to stop dumping of garbage around highways
398.article_body: Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) and National Highways Authority of India (NHAI) have formed vigilance teams in a joint operation to stop the dumping of garbage around highways and service roads. "Our teams...filed 94 cases so far and collected ₹65,490 in fines," PMC Deputy Commissioner (Solid Waste Management Department) Asha Raut said. The PMC also urged people to not dump waste.

399.title: WPI inflation falls to 10.7% in Sept, in double digits for 18 straight months
399.article_body: India's wholesale price index (WPI)-based inflation eased to 10.7% in September, the Ministry of Commerce and Industry data showed. WPI remained in the double digits for the 18th consecutive month beginning April 2021. WPI inflation surged to 12.41% during August, while it was revised to 14.07% from 13.93% for July, the data showed. WPI inflation in September 2021 was 11.80%.

400.title: Ekta Kapoor's Balaji Telefilms' ex-COO Zulfiqar Khan missing in Kenya since July
400.article_body: Ekta Kapoor's Balaji Telefilms' ex-COO Zulfiqar Khan has been missing in Nairobi, Kenya, since July this year. The 48-year-old went on holiday and was due to return on July 24. However, he dropped out of contact on July 21. The family has written to the government to trace him and also started an online campaign #BringZulfiBack.

401.title: Heavy to very heavy rainfall warning issued for several states till Oct 18, list released
401.article_body: The IMD, in its latest bulletin, issued heavy to very heavy rainfall warning for several states/UTs. It  is very likely over Andaman & Nicobar Islands, Tamil Nadu, Puducherry and Kerala from October 15 to 18. Further, Telangana may witness it on October 15 and Karnataka may witness it from October 15 to 17. Lakshadweep may witness it on October 18.

402.title: Hindu Sena files PIL in Delhi HC against Om Raut's 'Adipurush'
402.article_body: A PIL has been filed in Delhi HC against Om Raut's upcoming movie 'Adipurush', seeking removal of 'objectionable content' related to Lord Ram, Hanuman, Raavan and others. The plea has been moved by National President of Hindu Sena, Vishnu Gupta. It states that the movie has hurt the sentiments of Hindu community by depicting religious figures in an inappropriate manner.
